title: Computer Vision Scientist/Engineer
description:
Computer Vision Scientist/Engineer

At Expedition Technology, we push the boundaries of what is possible every day. Our engineers collaboratively solve the toughest problems in Computer Vision, Digital Signal Processing, Image Processing and more using Machine Learning/Deep Learning. We are a research-focused company whose mission it is to solve our customer's most pressing needs creatively and with cutting-edge algorithms. The solutions we develop enable autonomous operation, improve intelligence and simplify how things get done. We're doing this by building the most talented, multi-disciplinary research and engineering development team possible.

Are you an experienced (mid to senior level) Computer Vision/Image Processing scientist or engineer? Do you enjoy working on hard problems in an environment that respects your independence and need for work-life balance? If so, Expedition might just be the right place for you.

Note: US Citizenship is a requirement for ALL positions. All employees at Expedition Technology must hold or be eligible to obtain a US Government Security Clearance of Top Secret or higher. Non-US Citizens are not eligible for this level of clearance.

Key Responsibilities
Apply technical workflows for image processing, detection and tracking, full-motion-video analysis, and object recognition
Adapt existing codes to process and visualize data, which may include framing imagery, electro-optic (E/O), thermal, Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR), or LiDAR
Research and apply the latest machine learning/artificial intelligence methodologies for computer vision and image processing
Evaluate algorithm performance and develop modifications as needed
Develop applications that will efficiently process large data sets
Independently research available literature to fill in knowledge gaps and expand expertise
Prepare high quality graphics and technical briefings
Prioritize multiple tasks and complete technical milestones on schedule using agile development
Work both independently and with a team of scientists, engineers and software developers
Position Requirements
Due to security clearance requirements, US Citizenship is required for all of our positions.
An active TS/SCI US Government Security Clearance is highly preferred.
BS, MS, or PhD in electrical engineering, physics, mathematics, computer science, image science or closely related field. Advanced degrees highly desired.
Proficiency in Python/Numpy/Scipy, C/C++, or Julia development ; Python highly preferred
Desired Skills
We are seeking candidates with technical experience in several of the following topics: (need not have experience with all)
Scientific software development in one or more of Python/NumPy/SciPy, C/C++, or Julia; Python highly preferred
Algorithms and data structures relevant to efficient scientific software development
Experience with modern deep learning and probabilistic programming frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Bayesian statistics and inference
Detection, tracking and estimation theory
Satellite or airborne image processing
Full motion video processing
Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Processing
LiDAR data processing
Machine learning algorithms; deep learning experience with 2D and 3D Convolutional Neural Nets especially desired
Data fusion and image fusion
Image classification and/or automated target recognition
Spectral and geo-spatial image processing
EXP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes a diverse range of talent creates an environment that fuels creativity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic information or protected veteran status.

title: Computer Vision Scientist/Engineer-Perception
description:
Baidu USA, located in Silicon Valley, is looking for world-class engineers to join its IDG team a.k.a Intelligent Driving Group. The IDG team is aiming to develop advanced autonomous driving technologies which will let us transform mobility and improve the lives of billions of people. We are looking for a scientist/engineer with the strong computer vision and machine learning background to build one of the advanced autonomous driving systems in the world. He or she will be pushing the autonomous driving system from prototype towards volume production.

Here's what you will do:
Work with world-class talented group of software engineers and scientists to design and implement cutting edge autonomous driving technologies.
Train machine learning and deep learning models on a computing cluster to perform visual recognition tasks, such as segmentation and detection.
Enjoy access to large scale autonomous driving proprietary data, run experiments, learn, iterate, and ship
Here's what we'd like to see in you:
Strong academic or industry background on computer vision including image processing, deep network, SLAM, and detection/tracking
Strong understanding of machine learning: you should be familiar with the process (data collection, training, evaluation, and making iterative improvements) of building effective learning systems.
Strong ability to write to write high quality code in C++.
Experience with at least one main stream deep learning frameworks, including TensorFlow, Caffe(2), MXNet, PyTorch.
Experience with GPU programming languages including CUDA or openCL.
Strong engineering practices, debugging/profiling skills, familiarity with multi-threaded programming.
Experience in autonomous driving is a strong plus.
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience.
Culture fit:
Mission alignment: If you want to be part of Baidu IDG to accomplish our audacious mission, we will provide you with the best possible platform to do that.
Self­-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting ways to push the envelope?
Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.
Team orientation: We work in small, fast­-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team.

title: Experienced Ruby on Rails Engineer
description:
The development team is currently five engineers and we’re looking to grow the team. This is a very fast paced environment where each developer carries a significant amount of responsibility. The role is a mix of building new features while also helping us scale through a very fast growth ramp. Sample projects in the past have included building out a computer adaptive testing engine, building out elements of a learning management system, and maintaining a complex hierarchy of institutional permissions.

BoardVitals is built on Heroku, AWS, Ruby on Rails, PSQL, and Angular. At a minimum, the developer will be highly experienced in Ruby and a javascript framework (preferably Angular). Experience using Git/Github is a must have.

Developers at BoardVitals are highly involved in the decision making process. The role includes defining a long term infrastructure plan, being involved in strategy planning, and responding quickly to client needs. A successful candidate will have strong technical skills and the ability to interact with many different departments across the company.

Responsibilities
Working with a product manager to prioritize company needs
Leading as a senior developer on the team
Driving site architecture decisions
Developing new features for institutional clients, nurses, doctors, and other healthcare professionals
Building out learning management system/classroom functionality
Maintaining an active testing suite as well as a strong QA process that the developer will be personally responsible for
Managing and maintaining an active codebase
Responding quickly to changes
Maintaining 100% site uptime and proper backup and redundancy procedures
Managing usability, user testing, and feedback loops
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s Degree Required, Master’s Preferred
5+ Years of Development Experience
4+ Years of Ruby on Rails Development Experience
2+ Years of Javascript (preferably Angular) experience
Prior system architecture experience
Previous direct ownership of a successful product with high load/traffic
Strong technical and interpersonal references
A passion for education and healthcare are important. This company was founded to save lives and train better doctors, and we need someone who cares about what we do.
Compensation
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Health Plan
Vision
Dental
401k with up to 3% matching
Life Insurance
Annual Profit sharing plan
Regular lunches and snacks
We offer a very generous set of benefits. This is a well-funded and well-run company and we hope you’ll join us!

title: Quality Engineer Supervisor
description:
Assemblix LLC is now hiring immediate positions. Interview today and start tomorrow. We have full-time long term contract positions for hire!
We offer the following benefits: Health Insurance, Vision, Dental, Short Term, and Life insurance,
6 paid Holiday's, and 40 hours of paid time off.
401K after 90 days
1st shift position Monday through Friday 8:00-4:30.
Job Description
Manages Team of Quality Engineers and Technicians. Performs reviews of all failure analysis data that is provided by the failure analysis engineers and senior failure analysis technicians. This position identifies trend items and drive root cause and corrective actions on those Items. Coordinates ISO, EICC and BIS audits. Work involves communicating with both internal and external customers and suppliers. This position will drive the sub-tier quality initiative.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
• Responsible for the weekly failure analysis summary reports for both the internal team and external customer.
• Monitor defect trends and engage both our sub-tier vendors and the factory when those trends impact quality goals.
• Responsible to drive both the sub-tier vendors and factory for root cause and corrective action on all trend items.
• Responsible for the report on sub-tier and factory failure analysis reports to both the internal quality team and the external customer.
• Responsible for ISO9001, CQC and EICC compliance and certification
• Performs a variety of marginal duties not listed, to be determined and assigned as needed.
The successful candidate should be highly motivated to work on own initiative, and as a part of a team with excellent communication, planning, and organizational skills. We encourage recent college grads to apply.
We are a drug-free workplace and require a background check. The application can be filled out here in our office or candidates may also apply online at http://kcisatellite.appone.com

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by an organization recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA). Major course work in electrical engineering or a related field preferred. Each year of experience as described below in excess of the required five years may be substituted for thirty semester hours from an accredited college or university on a year-for-year basis.
• Five years full-time, wage-earning experience in manufacturing, engineering or a commensurate level of experience with quality processes.
Knowledge and Skills
• Excellent knowledge of Electronic Theory
• Excellent knowledge of PC system architecture
• Excellent skills at analyzing failure trends to determine process, component, or design flaws
• Excellent knowledge of electronic component functions within digital and analog circuits
• Very good understanding of SMT/PIH manufacturing and Test Process's
• Very good understanding of RMA Repair Process
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills at all Business levels (Mfg 9. Operator through Senior Management)
• Experience in Silicon Manufacturing and Testing a plus.
• Skilled with MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
• Excellent in problem solving, Leadership and Teamwork ability
• Certified auditor for ISO 9001
• Proven track record for ISO9001, CQC and EICC compliance
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS WITH OR WITHOUT REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION
• Ability to walk, stand, sit, kneel, push, stoop, reach above the shoulder, grasp, pull, bend repeatedly, identify colors, hear with aid, see, write, count, read, speak, analyze, alphabetize, lift and carry under 50 lbs., perceive depth, operate a motor vehicle, and operate motor equipment.
• Conditions may include working inside, working around machines with moving parts and moving objects, radiant and electrical energy, working closely with others, working alone, working protracted or irregular hours, and traveling by car, van, bus and airplane.
• Equipment (machines, tools, devices) used in performing only the essential functions include computer and related equipment, typewriter, calculator, copier, fax machine, telephone, and automobile.
• Mandarin speaking a plus

title: Software Engineer
description:
Do you want to love where you work and have your decisions and efforts make a direct impact on success? Buildable, Yamhill County’s fastest-growing custom software development firm, is looking for a Mid-Level Software Engineer to join their tight-knit team in McMinnville. With Buildable’s clients in an array of vertical markets, there are always exhilarating and refreshing problems to be solved. The atmosphere at Buildable makes every day exciting and rewarding.

Position
We’re looking for an experienced developer with a minimum of 3-5 recent years as full-stack engineer building web apps in a professional setting -- someone that doesn't just love solving challenging technical problems but cares about who we're solving these problems for. The right candidate will work in McMinnville with a small, dedicated team of engineers, designers, and project managers iterating quickly to ensure we build the best solutions.


Responsibilities

· Work on a Scrum team creating new features and fixing defects in our core products

· Write secure, maintainable, self-documenting code within business-driven timelines

· Communicate and collaborate in a team environment via email and Microsoft Teams.

· Flexibility and autonomy. Able to take direction as well as mentor others.

· Contribute to an environment that embraces best practices, continuous improvement, and professionalism

· Write high-quality code and evaluate the code quality of your peers.


Education + Experience

· Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience is required

· 3-5 years of ASP.NET software development experience


Required Knowledge + Skill

· Expert knowledge of C#, .NET Framework

· ASP.NET / ASP.NET Core

· RESTful API workflow

· Multi-Tasking, LINQ, Entity Framework, ReactiveUI, MVVM

· Javascript, Typescript

· JQuery, RxJs

· Angular or other Single Page Application frameworks (Angular, React, Vue, Knockout)

· HTML/CSS, JSON, XML

· Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL

· Git source control management

· Troubleshooting and debugging skills

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Previous experience working on a Scrum/Agile team


Not required, but desired:

· Knowledge of LDAP, SSO, DFA

· Ubuntu, or other Linux

· AWS, Azure


Compensation and Benefits
Competitive compensation based on experience.
Flexible Hours with PTO
Medical, Dental and Vision for Employee and Family
Annual Bonus Profit sharing
Professional Development Opportunities

LVSYS Corp dba Buildable is an equal opportunity employer - Buildable provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Seeking an emerging software applications superstar that enjoys developing machine control software for semiconductor processing equipment.

This is not your 'every-day' software coding type of job! If you're looking for an exciting opportunity to get hands-on experience and work as part of an active agile software engineering team, this opportunity is for you! You'll have opportunities to get out into the customer sites and observe your coding and machine controls in action.

At ASM Nexx, you'll also have great mentoring opportunities while working under the direction of a principal software engineer. You'll create and implement distributed device level control software that enables high-speed motion control of multiple axes. Our semiconductor equipment is used by companies that are creating the next generation of devices for IoT, (Internet of Things), mobile phones, and other connected devices. These products incorporate a diversity of mechanical, fluid, vacuum, and automation subsystems, which enable high-speed wafer processing equipment. Our technology makes semiconductor devices smaller, faster, and more power to improve the quality of lives. Come join us and build your future!

Primary Functions:
Develop software that incorporates state-of-the-art control software, connected together with factory integration and scheduling software, to include AI based predictive diagnostic software.
Working with process and equipment engineers, translate product requirements into machine control software requirements.
Collaborate with process engineering to implement data-driven chemical and material control algorithms for advanced process control using database architecture.
Run software tests and report on results.
Opportunities for global travel to assist customers with software upgrades and troubleshoot and implement software solutions.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, or relevant field, combined with 2 or more years' related software experience. (Master's degree preferred, but not essential).
Familiarity with equipment control software development, testing, and quality control.
Proficiency with C, C++, and C# .net programming
Ability to obtain a passport and travel approximately 10-15%, including both domestic and international travel.
Must be able to occasionally work in a clean-room environment and wear required personal protective equipment.
Self-motivated individual with ability to work alone and/or with limited supervision.
Ability to stand, walk, bend, lift up to 20 lbs. independently.
Candidates selected will be required to complete a drug screening and background check.
Women, minorities, and veterans are encouraged to apply.
We offer medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, along with a matching 401k retirement savings plan and an on-site fitness center.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:
C, C++, C# .net programming: 2 years (Required)
equipment control software development: 2 years (Required)
Computer Science, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering: 2 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
License:
Passport (Required)

title: Analytical Engineer
description:
Job Description
About you:

Do you enjoy a team driven environment in a structured environment with task focus? Are you someone who likes to move from one item to the next as priorities change? If this describes what motivates you every day, then this may be the position made for you.

What you’ll do:
Model and analyze new and existing products using virtual and experimental tools to provide both internal and external customers with the data necessary to produce products that satisfy the final customer’s requirements.
Participate in and contribute to component and system design processes from concept to production by analyzing, designing, and recommending methods to optimize OWC products using finite element analysis and multi-body dynamics software, other engineering software, and experimental and analytical methods while interfacing with designers, project and manufacturing engineers, and customers.
Create CAE reports for internal and external distribution.
Improve correlation between CAE and test results by incorporating experimental testing and new analytical methods.
Research, evaluate, and implement new ideas, methods, CAE software, hardware and new technology to support the organization’s goals.
What we’re looking for:
In addition you must have a minimum of two years Product Design Engineering experience, a minimum of one year product analysis experience. A minimum of one year of one year of Automotive Drive Line Product Analysis experience would be preferred.
A dedicated person who has earned their Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering field with additional training in a simulation discipline like finite element analysis. In addition, you must have a one year of product design, development, or analysis experience and one year of exposure to the implementation of an ISO/TS16949 compliant quality system. Automotive drivetrain experience is preferred.
Familiarity with GD&T, tolerance stacks, tolerance analysis software, Six Sigma, SPC, manufacture of powder metal components, and design of experiments.
Strong analytical background with experience using CAE tools including finite element analysis, multi-body dynamics, and/or computational fluid dynamics. Abaqus and Virtual Lab Motion preferred.
Experience with solid modeling (e.g. NX, Catia and Creo) and product lifecycle management (PLM). PTC Windchill PLM is preferred.
Experience with experimental mechanics including material and component testing, ASTM standards, strain gaging, modal analysis, and data acquisition.
Experience with one or more programming languages including .NET, Python, Matlab, Mathcad or equivalent engineering codes.
Who we are:

Means Industries, headquartered in Saginaw, MI, is a Tier 1 global automotive supplier of high value transformational propulsion-system technologies. Established in 1922, Means continues to foster a culture of collaboration through two business units, Means Propulsion Systems and Means TransForm Products. Our passion for problem solving drives everything we do and we remain committed to producing high quality innovative technology solutions for our global customers.

For more information about our company and to apply to this position, please visit our website (www.meansindustries.com).

Means is a division of Amsted Industries (www.amsted.com), one of the world’s largest transportation component manufacturers. Based in Chicago, Amsted specializes in products that serve the rail, heavy-duty vehicle, automotive, construction and general industrial markets. Amsted is one of the largest 100 percent employee-owned companies in the United States.

Means supports and cultivates creativity through a collaborative cross functional work environment. By nurturing innovation at all levels of the company, Means’ desire for progress and improvement helps launch pioneering, transformative technologies within the automotive industry.

With a high level focus on people development, you can grow and develop through diverse work experiences and quality training opportunities. Means is experiencing exponential growth and supports a culture where employees take pride and ownership in their work. As an employee owned company, you will recognize your direct impact on the business and be part of its success (US Only).

Means offers a comprehensive range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with employer matching, a health savings account with contribution for US employees and an excellent retirement package.

Means is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. No agencies.

title: Water Quality Staff Engineer
description:
The State of Idaho Department of Environmental Quality Technical Services Office in Boise is recruiting for a Water Quality Engineer. This position provides drinking water, wastewater, recycled water, and geotechnical engineering support to the programs and regions.

This position is established at the Technical Engineer 1 level and may be underfilled at the Staff Engineer level. The Technical Engineer 1 level requires four years POST-Professional Engineer (P.E.) licensure; the Staff level requires P.E. licensure with no requirement of experience post-licensure. Upon successful completion of a training plan and when minimum qualifications for the Technical Engineer 1 level are met, the incumbent will be reclassified to a Technical Engineer 1 and compensated accordingly.

To apply at the Technical Engineer 1 level, please go to the DEQ Water Quality Engineer announcement. Example of Duties:
Drinking water and wastewater construction project plans and specifications
Drinking water and wastewater facility planning projects
Wastewater lagoon seepage tests
Wastewater reuse permitting, inspections, and annual report reviews
Drinking water and wastewater inspections
State and federally funded drinking water and wastewater grand and loan projects
Landfill design and construction documents
Cyanide permitting activities
Lead and copper corrosion studies
Geotechnical engineering support
Minimum Qualifications:
Licensure: Licensed in Idaho as a Professional Engineer (PE); or eligible for comity licensure by the Idaho Board of Professional Engineers in accordance with Idaho Code, Title 54, Chapter 12;

AND
Valid driver's license.
Experience: analyzing, interpreting and applying federal, state and local laws when applying professional engineering principles and practices; writing technical engineering reports; evaluating, selecting and adapting standard engineering plans, specifications and standards in completing projects; coordinating field work and inspecting projects or facilities for compliance with standards.
Specialty Minimum Qualifications (required for this position):
DEQ (2882) Water Quality:
Requires at least six (6) credit hours of education related to water quality and/or water pollution control, including current technologies, construction and operation methods, mechanical systems, and material specifications to include inspection procedures; current federal clean water act or Safe Drinking Water Act, and related laws, guidelines, and practices applicable to wastewater, public drinking water, or solid waste systems; PLUS approximately two (2) years of engineering experience in the areas listed.

Supplemental Information:
Benefits:
Flexible work schedule and hourly wage for increased work-life balance.
Public Service Loan Forgiveness – eligibility requirements may apply.
Accrue paid vacation every pay period starting with approximately 2 weeks the first year, and increasing with state longevity
Paid sick leave separate from vacation leave
10 paid holidays
Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance benefits, Flexible Spending Account https://ogi.idaho.gov/premium-rates/
Relocation Assistance
Defined benefits retirement plan (pension) through the Public Employee Retirement System of Idaho (PERSI) and Vested after only 5 years. https://persi.idaho.gov/members/base_plan.cfm
Optional 401K and Deferred Compensation plans with traditional and Roth options
Eligible for Employee Assistance Program – Confidential support, information and resources for all of life's challenges.

Working at DEQ:
DEQ's vision is an Idaho where the quality of our environment enhances healthy living and supports thriving communities. DEQ works closely and collaboratively with a wide range of public and private partners, including federal and state agencies; the Board of Environmental Quality; city, county, and tribal governments; businesses; community organizations; and Idaho citizens. These partnerships are critical to accomplishing our environmental and human health protection mission. The agency is committed to working in partnership with local communities, businesses, and citizens to identify and implement cost-effective environmental solutions.
Physical requirements:
Ability to sit and work on a computer for 2-4 hours at a time
Ability to reach and bend for filing purposes
Some periods of heavy reading and typing required
Ability to lift 30 pounds when working with file boxes
Some travel may be required
Must have a valid driver's license
Ability to climb ladders, staircases, work on uneven terrain
Ability to lift and carry up to 30 pounds over rough terrain
Ability to work in adverse or inclement weather
Ability to work in extreme hot or cold temperatures both outside and inside
Ability to work on elevated instrument platforms, ladders, etc.
Must be able to swim and perform field monitoring work without on-site assistance or supervision
Field sites may involve working near and with drilling rigs, backhoes, trucks and other large equipment in rough terrain
Occasional travel required
May work in vicinity of loud noise
May be required to travel and stay overnight in remote areas
May come into contact with hazardous waste/materials
Eyesight needs to be 20/20 (as corrected) to observe field compliance

The Department of Environmental Quality may conduct verification of the information provided in your application, including validation of driver's license status, education, employment, and criminal history. Omission and/or falsification of information provided in your application will result in your removal from consideration for employment, appointment, or promotion.

To protect human healthand the quality of Idaho's air, land, and water.

Home: www.deq.idaho.gov

If you have questions, please contact us at: Email:deq.recruitment@deq.idaho.govPhone:(208) 373-0333

title: Civil Project Engineer
description:
HRC is growing and is currently searching for a Project Engineer to join our team.

Required Experience:

• Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering

• Registered professional engineer (P.E.) in Michigan

• Seven to 10 years of professional experience

• Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously

• Ability to work in a team environment

• Strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills

Responsibilities:

• Work in a teaming environment on complex municipal infrastructure projects, including roads, storm and sanitary sewer, pump stations, wastewater treatment plants, etc.

• Familiarity with a variety of computer packages for developing detailed designs including: MS Office, AutoCad and/or MicroStation, Civil 3D

• Developing the skills to manage multiple projects so as to be completed in a timely and accurate manner

• Preparation of engineering services proposals including estimates of time required to complete a project.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Assisting in the presentation of proposals to clients and selection of a project team.

• Reviewing designs and completing field investigation to diagnose problems

• Familiarity with completing projects within developed project scope and available resources.

• Willingness to participate in a team-oriented environment as well as function independently

• Develop reports and preliminary concepts

• Progressing toward leading a project team to assign duties to the team members, answer questions, and monitor overall project progress.

• Maintaining a close relationship with the client throughout project development, assisting the client in selecting contractors, and continuing client contact after project is completed.

Benefits:

• Team and family oriented work environment

• Advancement opportunities

• Medical, dental and vision insurance coverage

• Paid vacation and personal leave

• Hourly position with time and ½ overtime pay

• 401K Plan

• Employer sponsored continuing education

• Mentoring program

title: Senior Front End Engineer
description:
Our mission at Suplari is to shine the light on waste so that companies can invest in growth, innovation and their people. Our software delivers actionable insights from a company’s spend and procurement data by leveraging machine learning and AI, and visualizes these tailored recommendations and data trends in a clean, user-friendly interface. Customers realize hard dollar cost savings and effectively manage supplier risks that are often hidden within millions of data points and would take hours of manpower and bales of clunky spreadsheets to uncover.

Suplari is truly making an impact for clients such as Nordstrom, Tesla, 21st Century Fox and Hulu, (just to name a few) and we’re just getting started. We aim to “share the wealth” by providing businesses with the tools to reduce spend, mitigate risk and increase compliance, and we need your help!

Job Description

We are seeking a talented Senior Front End Engineer to join us at our downtown Seattle HQ.

Do you like finding creative solutions to challenging problems? Do you like to create something that makes a difference? Do you like to be part of a fast-growing company where you can put your mark on something early?

As an integral member of the engineering team, you will:
Work with other front-end/web application developers to build the Suplari platform and application suite.
Design, build and implement front-end web applications that are used by many major enterprises.
Work alongside other passionate engineers to change the way enterprise businesses interact with their suppliers.

What to bring:
While you don’t need to have experience in every technology we use, as a startup, we do expect you to be comfortable contributing everywhere on the front-end and to a lesser extent on the back-end stacks.
Expert level experience with Javascript using Angular, React or Node frameworks
Experience in any of the following languages: Go, Python or Java
Experience with cloud configuration and deployment technologies
Experience developing applications in AWS
Enthusiasm for actively mentoring and giving feedback, as well as receiving feedback from others
Rigor in automated testing, continuous integration, DevOps and other engineering best practices
Agile enough to jump into a broad range of projects
BS and/or MS in computer science or a related field
7+ years experience in software engineering

We’d love to hear from you if:
You love being a part of a small, dynamic and agile organization that encourages you to learn and grow
You love finding solutions to interesting problems
You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks
You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team

Why Suplari?
Competitive compensation package
Ownership through equity and options
Comprehensive, company-paid medical, dental and vision benefits
Been there, done that team: Our management team has a track record of success at companies such as HP, Amazon, Apptio, Skytap, iConclude, Trulia and Zillow
Suplari is backed by top tier venture capital investors: Madrona Venture Group, Shasta Ventures, Amplify Partners, Two Sigma Ventures and Workday Ventures
Opportunity to make a critical impact at an early stage company

Location:
This position will be located in the Seattle area
We are not interviewing remote employees at this time

Suplari is an equal opportunity employer!

title: Process Engineer
description:
Quote new jobs, develop bill of material, manufacturing process router, quality plan and provide shop technical support. Must have a strong background in machining, blueprint reading, GD&T. Prefer BS degree in ME or MET. Must have minimum five years similar engineering experience. Strong computer literacy, written and verbal communication, and project management skills are required.

Excellent Benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision insurance options, Onsite Health and Wellness Center, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), 401k, Paid Time Off (PTO), 10 paid Holidays, Life Insurance, Voluntary Life for dependents, Educational Assistance, Short & Long Term Disability Insurance. We care about the health of our employees and provide a tobacco free facility, onsite fitness center and wellness events.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

title: Cloud Network Engineer
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
This position provides coordination, support, monitoring, installation and best practices of IT systems companywide, including office environments, remote users, datacenters, and other computing resources. This is a mid-level position that requires a deep technical ability.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ALL EMPLOYEES:
Strive to exhibit ER’s Valued Employee Attributesto support our company values and culture.
Adhere to applicable policies and procedures.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF EVERYONE IN THIS DEPARTMENT:
Work towards objectives of Security availability and performance
Participate in on-call rotation
Clearly communicate problems with your team or to your manager
Uphold and adhere to team policies, procedures and responsibilities
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Contributes to the daily operations of ER’s datacenters, Azure cloud operations, and office networked systems.
Monitors daily system heath reports and create or modify as needed.
Contributes to configuring and maintaining routers, firewalls, load balancers, switches, VPN systems, encryption certificates, and other related networking technology or appliances.
Configures and maintains Windows and Unix web servers, file servers, domain controllers, databases, and any other server in the ER environment. Includes physical computers, virtual servers running on ER hardware, and Azure cloud servers.
Applies security best practices and actively participates in the DoD auditing and security process.
Performs system upgrades as directed such as Windows operating system and database server products.
Monitor system backups in place and check they are functioning appropriately. Performs test restores of backups to verify the data was stored properly and is usable on restore. Supports continuous process improvement with the goal of making Emergency Reporting products and services as efficient and effective as possible.
Travel to company datacenters as needed for installation and regular maintenance.
In conjunction with others, contributes and maintains deployment scripts for code deployment to all environments.
OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS:
Participates in assessment of new technologies as needed by the development team.
Attends all hands meetings, company trainings, manager meetings, or other company events.
Assists in office IT issues as needed.
Performs other duties as assigned by the IT Manger.
QUALIFICATIONS – EDUCATION, LICENSES & EXPERIENCE:
2+ years experience in Azure datacenter operations in a primary and standby environment for a software as a service company (SaaS)
Responsible for design, development, and hands-on implementation of Azure cloud solutions
Serve as an Azure technical resource in team’s efforts to determine the needs of our businesses that will simplify and automate the applications as well as make them more efficient
Participate in planning, implementation, and growth of our Azure foundational footprint
Experience administering/supporting Windows and Linux systems running in Azure
Experience with Azure NSG and ASE
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure virtual network appliances
Experience with PowerShell
Experience with Active Directory including managing/maintaining several domains
Log analysis experience with specific knowledge of Azure Log Analytics and App Insights a plus
SQL Server experience in a SaaS production environment or other equivalent experience preferred.
Experience with working with web applications technologies.
Associates degree in computer science, information systems or other IT related field.
Experience with security audits, such as DoD or PCI.
Other combinations of education and experience that provide the incumbent with the necessary qualifications may be considered.
QUALIFICATIONS – KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Azure Cloud Platform Certifications are a huge plus
2+ years of experience with network virtualization hypervisors and SDN, and ability to troubleshoot Azure cloud communication issues
Goals- and results-oriented, with a passion for excellence.
Effective written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Organized and detail- and accuracy-oriented, including ability to effectively document and resolve issues.
Able to learn and adapt to changing technologies and procedures.
Able to document procedures and processes.
Able to be a competent, effective, and collaborative team player.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, problem solve and work independently.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Incumbent is subject to a background check and appropriate security clearances.
Must have a valid driver’s license.
WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Travel: Some travel may be required.
Mobility: Work is performed in an office setting and requires sitting for long periods of time.Must be able to move throughout the office to interact with employees.
Hearing: Must be able to hear verbal conversations over the phone, using collaboration tools, and in-person with background noise.
Vision: Must be able to consistently identify objects and persons at a distance and read fine print on various forms.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
St. Louis – Cloud Engineer
RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze the cloud infrastructure needs of the Company’s product units and transversal functions.
Participate to selection and deployment of Openstack distribution (SLA, performance, support, cost).
Design and implement private cloud infrastructure. Ensure full integration with hybrid cloud platform management layer, identity management and R&D infrastructure. Work closely with other engineering teams.
Ensure operations, scaling, maintenance of our private cloud infrastructure
Support the organization in maturing the infrastructure into a fully automated, service-oriented, hybrid IT.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with Azure and/or Amazon cloud technologies and Linux
Experience with tools like Puppet and Ansible
User level experience with Openstack
Great knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. Python)
Knowledge of cloud networking architecture, cloud operations, security, automation and orchestration
Experience with virtualization technologies, in particular VMWare and KVM
Experience with the implementation and/or operations of medium to large-scale enterprise cloud infrastructures
ABOUT US

At US Cloud, we believe that the kind of office culture that provides you a challenge and an inspired outlet for creativity has a direct result on our clients’ satisfaction. So, to be the premier managed services and cloud provider, we focus on fostering a happy place for you to thrive. We’re always looking out for talented professionals to help in sales, marketing, engineering, development, and security. You can move quickly through the ranks here, or pivot into a new area of interest. You control your destiny and will make a difference each day as an US Clouder.

Besides medical, dental, vision, matching 401k, life insurance, and disability insurance, we also provide:
Starbucks iCup Bean-Grinded Coffee Machine (and all the Starbucks you can drink)
Kindles for all (and all the free Harry Potter or coding books you want)
Healthy snacks (and occasionally donuts)
Dogs in the office (cats in the datacenter)
Gym membership (near your home or by the office)
Fun monthly events (get to know your team)
No morning meetings (so you can get stuff done!)
Tuition assistance (knowledge is power)
Free parking (to park your ride, not the payout in Monopoly)

title: Investment Castings (IGT) Product Engineer
description:
PRODUCT ENGINEER
Develops manufacturing process based on customer blueprint and specifications to fulfill company strategic goals while integrating the needs of marketing, sales and manufacturing departments. Troubleshoots process problems and provides technical support to manufacturing to ensure the on time production of investment castings that meet the highest quality standards at the lowest possible cost.

Interface with customer representatives to develop new products, and support general customer program requirements.

Identify needs and goals for a new product, from function to aesthetics.

Lead development projects, and deliver on time.

Review customer specifications and blueprints to determine the procedures, testing, and routing sequences required to meet the dimensional requirements.
Utilizes process knowledge, basic engineering principles, previous experience, and creativity as necessary to develop processes that result in the production of quality castings that conform to customer specifications and time tables
Develop new technology to support plant
Reviews all layouts, tool reworks and tool construction as necessary to ensure consistency and repeatability of process resultS
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE PRODUCT ENGINEER
B/S in Mechanical Engineering or other related fields of experience.
5 years experience aerospace investment casting, cored IGT product.
Proven track record of part development and delivering projects on time.


QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS/ABILITIES FOR BOTH

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret blueprints, customer specifications, general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Able to be computer illeteriate. In accordance with ITAR regulations, position requires US citizen or Permanent Resident status.

Must be able to perform essential functions of the job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk; sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

The employee frequently works near moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, and vibration. The noise level in the work environment varies from quiet in office areas to very loud in the manufacturing environment. However, the eight-hour time weighted exposure to noise averages less than 85 dBA.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
B/S in Metallurgical, Materials or Chemical Engineering or other related fields of experience.
5 yrs experience in aerospace investment casting, cored IGT product.
Proven track record of casting development and improvement.

title: Firmware Engineer I
description:
Overview

Generac Power Systems - Work with the leader in the power industry! Our Corporate Headquarters in Waukesha, WI, is seeking a Firmware Engineer I to join our expanding Remote Monitoring team.

The Engineer I is responsible for providing engineering input to the product development projects assigned to him/her including interfacing with the cross functional team consisting of engineering, operations (industrial engineering, production, and material procurement), sourcing, quality, service, and marketing. This position will primarily focus on the design and development of microcontroller based embedded software or firmware used in engine powered tools, portable generators, and home standby generators.

Responsibilities
Designs, validates, and brings new products to market - specific responsibilities include designing and developing application software/firmware for embedded controllers in C, defining interface requirements, and creating firmware for communication interfaces and/or system algorithms
Provide new product development support in the Industrial, Commercial, Residential and/or Retail generator or Power Tool product area including: supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs), interfacing with internal company personnel, and providing technical support for assigned projects.
Specifies precise new product functional requirements; designs, tests and integrates standard, less complex components to produce final designs; and evaluates the design's overall effectiveness, cost (including cost/benefit analysis), reliability (risk analysis), and safety.
Designs, develops, executes and evaluates fitness-for-use testing, product specifications and process validation plans for standard products and/or components; creates and reviews material part specifications and bills of materials.
Collaborates with internal manufacturing partners, contract manufacturers, designers and product specialists to optimize basic designs for manufacturability.
Utilizes CAD (Computer Aided Design) or CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) systems to model new designs and produce detailed engineering drawings.
Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs).
Acts as a resource to more experienced engineers.
Act as SAP Super User within functional area as assigned.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor or Master of Science Degree in in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline
0 – 3 of years (Previous relevant work experience preferred)
Preferred Qualifications:
Uses basic engineering knowledge to improve products or services
Able to solve basic engineering problems; good decision-making skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office software, especially Excel
Proficient oral and written communication
Experience with Freescale PowerPC and/or Microchip PIC microcontrollers
Familiarity with software compilers and debugging tools
Experience with code management tools like SVN
Familiarity with reading circuit schematic
Use of circuit simulation software such as P-Spice
Experience in design of industrial/automotive electronic control systems and assemblies
Communication protocol knowledge with serial, Ethernet, USB, SPI, I2C
Digital Signal Processing
RF/wireless controls knowledge
Design to meet agency compliance such as UL, CSA, NEC, CE, NFPA, EPA
Previous experience using SAP or equivalent ERP
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job include are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.

title: Java Software Engineers - DCIM Systems
description:
Ready to grow? Panduit’s software team in Folsom, California, develops next-generation technologies that view data centers as a system to be optimized to save energy and run reliably. We're a collaborative team of engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including UI design, data storage and retrieval, third-party device communication and control, distributed computing, large-scale system design, security, enterprise scalability, functional programming; the list goes on and is always growing. We need mid-career (7 to 10 years) or senior (10+ years) Java full stack software engineers to join a dynamic development team where you will apply your software engineering skills on commercially released products critical to Panduit’s corporate vision, with opportunities to switch focus to other components of the system as you and our products grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, self-motived, display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Minimum Qualifications
BS degree in Computer Science or a similar technical field of study is required
10+ years of relevant experience for senior (or possibly principal) positions; 5 to 10 years for mid-level developers
Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to Java, C#, Python, JavaScript, Erlang (or any functional language)
Interest and ability to quickly learn Java, JavaScript and/or Erlang if those are not already your strengths
Expertise in at least one of the following areas, with the interest and ability to learn others: web application design and development, enterprise Java systems, functional programming, distributed systems, scalable architecture, high-performance data storage and retrieval, asynchronous service-oriented architecture
Prior experience working in an Agile environment
Strong problem-solving skills
Self-motivated but also self-aware enough to know when to ask for assistance without delay
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with one or more of the following: General Java programming for performance and scalability, Java Servlets, JavaScript/HTML5, Java Swing, Erlang
Database expertise, preferably SQL
Atlassian Tool Set (Jira, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Confluence)
Git, GitHub
Sencha cross-platform tools, i.e., Ext JS
Experience with scene graph data structures and visualization concepts
Experience with SNMP, BACnet, or Modbus protocols
If you meet several of the qualifications listed, come join us and build a career you can be proud of, with a company that's a global technology leader. Please apply online today for our thoughtful consideration. (Recruiter, Liz Klein, eklein@accolo.com, 469-223-4900.)

Panduit provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants, regardless of a person’s age, race, color, physical or mental disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, military or veteran status, national origin, religion, religious creed, sex, sexual orientation, or any other protected status under federal, state, or local law.

Since 1955, Panduit has offered end-to-end industrial, electrical, and network infrastructure solutions that deliver best-in-class network performance with superior quality, operational efficiency, and easy installation. Innovative infrastructure offerings from Panduit – from the known and trusted network cables to design plans that maximize data center investment – affect day-to-day operations and profitability, and become the foundation for successful, connected, future-ready businesses. With a robust partner ecosystem, global staff, and unmatched service and support, Panduit is a valuable and trusted advisor and provider, helping companies around the globe solve infrastructure challenges. For more information, visit www.panduit.com.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer
Location


Boise, Idaho

Job Code

1919R

# of openings

1

Apply Now

About Healthwise
Healthwise is a global provider of health information, decision support tools, behavior change assistance, and personal care planning for the top health plans, care management companies, hospitals, and consumer health portals. Each year, millions of people use our content and tools to manage their health, make better health decisions, and live healthier lives. Above all, we believe that our people are the most important part of our nonprofit organization. When you join Healthwise, rest assured that you’ll be among people who are passionate about their work and who combine dedication to our mission with a commitment to work/life balance. To help maintain that balance, our Boise campus boasts a fully equipped gym; walking, running, and biking trails; healthy snacks; company bicycles; and a host of exercise classes—all on-site. Our offices are on the road to the local ski area. And we work in beautiful buildings, filled with natural light and the best of regional art. We come together frequently as a company to assess and improve our internal culture, find ways to work smarter and serve our clients better, and help each other meet the demands of work and of life. The caliber of our people, our understanding of client needs, and our commitment to our mission all give Healthwise a bright future innovating the next generation of consumer health content. We hope you’ll join us.

Job Summary
The Software Engineer is responsible for providing vision, guidance, and technical expertise as part of the development of Healthwise systems and software. This individual will provide technical leadership to engineers, and will work with a team of developers, product managers, administrators, and testers to develop systems for Healthwise. This individual will drive for results delivering quality software within budgeted time. The Software Engineer will demonstrate a passion for innovation staying apprised of emerging technologies and drive to integrate these innovations into Healthwise products and into the practices of the development team company-wide.

Duties & Responsibilities
Roles and Responsibilities of the Software Engineer include but are not limited to:
Interacts with other departments and internal users as part of development of the Healthwise software and systems.
Depending on experience serves as architectural lead; leads development of new or revised systems and internal applications.
Provides leadership and direction to engineers developing tools and processes to improve continuous integration and automated testing at Healthwise.
Contributes innovative and visionary designs for complex software systems.
Participates in technical design reviews, code reviews, and some pair programming.
Works with users to resolve technical issues and to provide implementation support.
Contributes to development of company objectives and principles, and achieves goals in creative and effective ways.
Performs other duties as assigned or needed.
Demonstrate Skills & Knowledge
Expert working knowledge and understanding of application development with web services.
Expert level experience with RESTful services on a variety of platforms, both creating and consuming services.
Expert level experience with XML.
Expert level experience with integration of multiple systems using technologies like service bus and message queues.
Passion for building systems that build things.
Expert working knowledge of automated testing tools and methodologies, unit testing frameworks and test driven development methodologies.
Strong ability to define software requirements, identify technical gaps and risks.
Strong knowledge of relational databases.
Extensive experience creating software development estimates.
Experience developing and appreciation of continuous integration/deployment/automation using tools like Jenkins, Go, Grunt, or others.
Extensive experience working with source control systems (Git strongly preferred).
Experience developing, integrating, and testing Content Management Systems.
Ability to prioritize tasks, to organize, and to coordinate a high volume of information.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Strong interpersonal and interviewing skills.
Understanding of and ability to communicate the business and strategic impact of technical decisions.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent work experience and 5 - 10 years in a related field.
3+ years’ experience in an object-oriented language and use of common software design patterns.
3+ years’ experience developing automation and tools to facilitate continuous integration of software development efforts.
3+ years’ experience with XML and related technologies.
Experience with a wide variety of development platforms is strongly preferred.
All offers are contingent upon the completion of a background check.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential functions satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodation.
Healthwise is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. If you require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request through one of the methods listed below: Email: hr@healthwise.org Mailing Address: Healthwise, Incorporated Attn: Human Resources 2601 Bogus Basin Road Boise, ID 83702 Fax: 208-387-6776

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
At Mobile Mini, we believe that providing the best service and products starts with hiring the best people and investing in them. After all, it’s the people who make it happen! We are currently seeking a dynamic and skilled Business Intelligence Engineer to join our growing team. Reporting to the BI Manager, this position ensures the business and BI team has the tools it requires to work operationally.

As the BI Engineer, you will serve as a key function in the continuous development and support of BI applications, system integrations, and the live BI data platform design. You will manage multiple environments as well as support activities of keeping the high availability of reporting online while keeping the business informed and engaged daily.

What You'll Do:
Maintain multiple ETL integrations using SAP Data Services, smart data integration (SDI), and other tools.
Maintain upgrades, patching and hotfixes as required for BI applications.
Design data models for BI data platform in SAP HANA and other systems as required.
Identify and execute on continuous improvement of the existing data foundations.
Ensure compliance with security policies and practices in accordance with internal and external audit governing bodies.
Make recommendations and ensure quality assurance and support processes are running effectively.
Provide professional and prudent communications working in a team environment with a diverse group of associates.
Work closely with IT project management team to deliver resources to projects in a timely and effective manner.
Regularly report against uptime and availability and ensure both IT senior management and the business are kept proactively informed.
Understand the requirements and provide technical direction in the analysis, design, development, documentation, testing, deployment, maintenance and enhancement of complex technical solutions related to enterprise BI projects.
Ability to create technical design documents (TDD) and unit test documents for all technical solutions.
Ensure Agile and ITIL processes are adhered to for integrations.
Maintain a strong ethical approach to vendors, customers and staff which is aligned with the ethical principles of the company.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking current practices; participating in professional societies.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What You'll Need To Be Successful:
Significant experience in managing SAP Business Objects applications, ETL integrations and data modeling.
High level of technical competence and a strong understanding of BI data processes, modeling and best practices.
Proven experience in building and managing ETL instances with SAP Data Services.
Proven experience with real-time systems integration.
Experience with BI tools including SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence, Information Design Tool, and Tableau.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills.
Strong prioritization and time-management skills.
Understanding of Agile and ITIL methodologies and processes is preferred.
Experience with InfoBurst Administration for report scheduling, 360 Suite for promotions, etc, and native SAP HANA hands-on development; all preferred.
At A Minimum, You'll Have:
2+ years of SAP Data Services
2+ years of data modeling and design
2+ years of SAP Business Objects Administration
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
Additional years of experience in similar roles will be considered in lieu of formal education
Strong SQL skills
Experience with the following tools: SAP Business Objects 4.x (end to end), SAP Data Services 4.x, SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence, SAP Business Objects Information Design Tool, SAP HANA, MS SQL Server
How You’ll Be Rewarded:

Mobile Mini recognizes, rewards and offers growth opportunities for talented employees at all levels of the company, and empowers our employees to make informed and timely decisions. In addition, we offer a competitive compensation plan including quarterly bonus, health/dental insurance, vision, 401(k) and life insurance). We believe in promoting people based on ability, not seniority; so if you’re ready, we have opportunity for you to excel!

Mobile Mini, is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment. Mobile Mini takes affirmative action in support of this policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, disabled, and veterans. Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile & Web
description:
Delta Defense is the private company that provides Marketing, Operations and Customer Care for the USCCA. The USCCA provides self-defense education, training, and legal protection to the most responsible gun owners.

Delta Defense, LLC, is one of the fastest-growing companies in America.

Inc. 5000 company SEVEN years in a row!
Journal Sentinel Top Workplace - 3 years in a row
Milwaukee Business Journal Top Workplace - 3 years in a row

We are a fun, fast-paced and rewarding place to work and grow!

We hire rockstars, and help them rock even harder!

Position Summary:

We are looking for a QA Engineer to assess software & native mobile application quality through manual and automated testing. In this role, you should have a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills, as well as knowledge of native mobile application interactions. If you are also competent in designing, writing, and executing test cases and are passionate about quality, we'd like to meet you. Responsibilities and duties include the manual & automated testing of new software and new native mobile application builds in both the pre- and post-release stage of the development lifecycle. Ultimately, you will ensure that our applications and systems work correctly.

Duties/Responsibilities:
Define and create test cases based on acceptance criteria and in conjunction with best practices established by our overall QA team.
Determine test case candidates for automation, providing the appropriate validation as defined in the test case.
Write automated integration and/or UI tests to be included in the regression suite.
Participate in executing manual test cases, where required as well as release regression testing.
Review acceptance criteria and discuss with the developers to determine unit test case coverage.
Participate in the code review process ensuring unit tests have been implemented based on the predetermined acceptance criteria unit test coverage.
Advocate for quality within cross-functional development teams.
Actively work with developers on test automation best practices.
Update and maintain an automated regression test suite while expanding UI functional test coverage.
Contribute to our test frameworks and services.
Coordinate testing efforts to ensure the delivery of quality features.
Contribute to our long-term vision and strategy for QA and Test Automation.
Make testing an integral part of the development process.
Report bugs and follow them through the complete bug life cycle
Review new Mobile Application builds on both Android and iOS devices to ensure the builds follow the design patterns for those devices.
Skills/Abilities and Education Requirements:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent
2-3 years of related Quality Engineering, Software Engineering experience
Javascript experience required
CodeceptJS experience is a plus!
Knowledge and experience with native Android & iOS application and their design patterns
Experience writing test plans and test cases are required
Experience working with automation tools such as Selenium is required
Superior problem-solving skills.
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to identify and resolve problems
Demonstrates the Core Values of Delta Defense, LLC

title: Network Engineer I
description:
Schedule: 8:00a-4:30p Monday-Friday, Weekends as needed

Basic Function:

The Network Engineer I embodies the Memorial Health System Performance Excellence Standards of Safety, Courtesy, Quality, and Efficiency that support our mission, vision and values. These standards are evident in the daily work, which includes responsibility for all network hardware and related technologies including: Routers, Switches, Wireless, VPN, and WAN circuits. The Network Engineer I is responsible for the constant monitoring of performance, availability, support and maintainability of all Cisco network infrastructure, hardware and related software. Identify opportunities to improve user experience and functionality through evaluation, collaboration and implementation of new network technologies and functionality and migrating to new solutions as appropriate. Primary role of this position is to support the enterprise network; including successfully working of daily support tickets.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer related field required. Three to four years experience in Enterprise Level Networking may be considered in lieu of degree.
Cisco Certified Networking Associate certification preferred
Knowledge of Cisco IOS, STP, VLAN’s, EIGRP, Cisco 3750, 3750X, and 6500 LAN switching, CISCO ASA and VPN technologies, and Cisco Nexus line, including VDC and OTV.
Understanding of all facets of enterprise networking, hardware, and software technologies.
Ability to assess, develop and implement creative solutions to ensure appropriate support of network.
Must possess strong oral and written communication skills, planning skills, problem-solving skills, and change management skills.
Must possess strong skills in personal diplomacy and customer service and consistently demonstrate a high level of motivation, commitment to teamwork, professionalism and trustworthiness.
Must possess sound decision-making ability, operate well under pressure and be tenacious in resolving difficult problems.
Demonstrated ability to deal effectively with staff at all levels of the organization including medical staff and senior management.
Required Skills

Required Experience

Job Location
Springfield, US-IL

title: Applications Engineer
description:
Apply

Description

Samson, the worldwide leader in high performance cordage, is seeking Applications Engineer to join our team.

The Applications Engineer serves as a primary technical product resource for Samson’s products, interacting with external customers, the Commercial Team, and Research & Development regarding technical issues or potential new applications for Samson products considered to be more complex in nature. The successful candidate is expected to practice a high level of business ethics, professionalism, safety and quality in all activities in accordance with Samson strategy and core values.
Provide technical assistance to sales/customers with respect to the use of Samson products and participate as technical representative in alliance partnerships.
Work in conjunction with Sales, Market Strategy Managers, R&D and external resources as needed to find new applications for Samson products or to develop new specifications for new products.
Ensure that Samson products comply with or exceed all appropriate Federal, State and other governing bodies’ specifications and/or regulations.
Monitor the quality of applications developed to ensure that all appropriate standards are followed.
Gather technical data from customers and assist in the design of their particular systems or provide solutions in accordance with the data. Qualify, institute and report the inspection and/or testing of product as requested by customers.
Assist in the development of technical papers and articles for publication and/or presentation on behalf of the company’s technology and associated applications.
Provide technical training on products, applications and terminations to company personnel, customers and others as required.
Participate in sales calls with RSM's.
Serve as technical Subject Matter Expert in assigned industries through participation in market strategy efforts as well as support of related opportunities, initiatives, and development projects.
Manage projects as assigned.
Continuous learning and education regarding industry knowledge, Samson products, and best practices.
Strong understanding in area of responsibility to assist and train team members as needed.
Supports Lean initiatives and activities.
For 140 years, Samson has paved the road to success with innovation, quality, and service. Samson knows that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts: From our Corporate Headquarters and manufacturing in Ferndale, Washington, to the manufacturing floor in Lafayette, Louisiana, to our international sales teams, our people are what make the difference in the product and to the customer.

A career at Samson is challenging, rewarding, and satisfying. We accomplish our goals when each individual performs to their full potential while contributing as a valuable team player with others in the organization.

Samson offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k with company match, education reimbursement, PTO, education assistance, and 11 paid holidays.

We are a drug free, tobacco free workplace, and an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran).

Employment is contingent on a successful background and drug screen.

Requirements

Requirements:

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field

Experience

Minimum of 3 years of experience of satisfactory performance in a direct customer support role in a manufacturing/industrial environment. Demonstrated capabilities of leading projects effectively

Other required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to influence through trust, listening, and understanding the needs of both colleagues and customers.
Understand expectations and work independently under minimum supervision.
Excellent technical training skills with the ability to communicate technical solutions clearly.
Ability to build relationships at all levels in the organization as required by the position and to work well with a diverse group of individuals.
Ability to deliver excellent customer service to both colleagues and customers.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing with a strong attention to detail.
Analytical and quantitative skills.
Advanced computer skills including use of Microsoft Office, 3D modeling programs (SolidWorks), and ability to learn new programs.
Creative problem solving, with the ability to recommend and implement solutions.
Ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
Mental & Physical Demands/Working Conditions:

Mental Effort:
Ensure that all activities conform to Company policies, and all appropriate laws and regulations.
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the Company. Exhibit a professional manner in dealing with others to maintain constructive working relationships.
Physical Requirements:
Prolonged sitting at a workstation.
Use of a telephone for extensive periods of time.
Lifting up to 10 pounds occasionally. May seldom lift up to 50 pounds.
Must be able to hear and perceive the nature of sounds by ear.
Specific vision abilities include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
Working Conditions:
Primarily working in an office environment with some exposure to manufacturing environment.
Must follow all safety guidelines as it relates to personal protective equipment when in the manufacturing facility or external operation sites.
Ability to travel approximately 40% to 50% of the time.
Must have a Valid US Passport or Passport Card for international travel

title: Electrical Engineering Manager
description:
Overview

Generac Power Systems - Work with the leader in the power industry! Our Corporate Headquarters in Waukesha, WI, is seeking an Engineering Manager to join our expanding Remote Monitoring team. This role will lead a team of Firmware Engineers, Hardware Engineers, and supporting technicians.

The Engineering Manager is responsible for all engineering activities including new product introductions, cost reduction, technology/research, and lifecycle product support. The position requires excellent technical engineering knowledge coupled with superior people leadership skills, proficiency in quality systems, functional and program management experience and business planning expertise.
