The Structural Engineer III performs structural analyses of low-to-high complexity on existing communication structures (including guyed, self-supporting, monopoles and their foundations) and prepares formal, written reports detailing tower capacity and recommendations for modifications needed to increase capacity. The incumbent also designs new towers, tower foundations and basic-to-complex modifications to existing towers. The incumbent will also provide quality control review of engineering services performed by other engineers. The Structural Engineer III is expected to independently perform many of the position’s essential duties.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Perform calculations and prepare drawings and reports for technically complex structural engineering projects.
Design modifications for tower reinforcement, extensions and foundations.
Train team members in use of complex engineering modeling software including tnxTower, RISA-3D, Caisson, LPILE, AutoCAD, and proprietary engineering tools to solve complex engineering problems.
Lead or help with technical committees and report progress as required.
Provide quality control review of engineers.
Mentor engineers when required
Ensure the quality and accuracy of calculations, reports, and drawings produced by team.
Lead departmental committees responsible for developing new engineering calculations and tools and improving internal standards.
OTHER FUNCTIONS (This list of other functions is not exhaustive and may be supplemented and changed as necessary
Responsible for quality of final reports in terms of technical aspects and report writing.
Preparation of technically complex engineering studies and reports
Expertise in engineering modeling software including txnTower, RISA-3D, Caisson, LPILE, AutoCAD, and proprietary engineering tools to solve complex engineering problems.
Expertise in all facets of telecommunications structural engineering.
Conduct construction inspections.
Engineering production as required.
Provide training for other engineering as required.
Assist in specific client management as outlined by the Manager/Director/Vice President.
Responsible for client satisfaction.
Prepare letters and e-mails for corresponding with clients and contractors.
Actively foster a work environment that is based upon openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction.
Responsible for the development of team Project Engineers.
Responsible for leadership role on engineering committees.
Maintain ADP.

Bachelor or Master of Science in Civil Engineering from an ABET accredited institution, preferably with a focus in structural or civil engineering.
5 years’ experience in tower engineering or commercial building design.
Experience in engineering project management required.
Experience in tnxTower required.
PE license required or should be obtained within one year.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSURES, REGISTRATIONS
Actively participate in professional organizations and societies.
KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES
Expertise in analysis and design of steel, concrete, wood, and masonry structures and foundations.
Expertise in computer programs including MS Office, tnxTower, RSIA-3D, Caisson, LPILE, and AutoCAD.
Expertise in TIA, AISC, ACI and other structural standards and national building codes.
Expertise in manual numeric calculations and hand sketches to accurately represent building or tower design components.
Excellent visualization and interpretation of engineering evaluations.
Expertise in horizontal and vertical design loads.
Oral and written communication skills.
Writing reports and business correspondence.
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Engineering project management.
Client management.
Ability to develop engineers’ skills in engineers.
Self-motivated and able to work independently to complete task and production.
MENTAL DEMANDS
Ensuring productivity despite expectation of constant distractions.
Must be able to represent the company well in high pressure situations, requiring adjustment of communications depending on audience.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Consistent with standard work in-office; some expected lifting of file boxes, including loading and unloading.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Standard office environment.

Action Oriented - is action oriented and works well with challenges., Business Acumen - Knowledgeable in the business, policies, practices and trends., Customer Focus - Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers., Drive for Results - Pushes self and others for results., Functional Technical Skills - Has functional and technical knowledge and skills.
This position does not have direct reports

title: Devops Engineer
description:
Active Data Technologies is a profitable, fast growing, e-commerce company representing several brands. We are looking for a bright, passionate and creative DevOps Engineer to join our team. We are an automation oriented, forward thinking organization looking for team members who share our vision.

The DevOps Engineer reports to the DevOps Manager, and will assist or perform the following:
Troubleshooting critical production issues across platforms and applications as required.
Carry out production deployments, identifying and patching bugs and reducing inefficiencies.
Building and maintaining monitoring and reporting frameworks as well as tools used to streamline and automate tasks throughout the platform lifecycle.
Create, facilitate and evangelize automated workflows.
Provide coworkers with IT support.
This role will provide the opportunity to interact directly with end users to resolve technical issues. As well as exposure to various technologies including, but not limited to, AWS, Ansible, Elasticsearch, Jenkins, Terraform, Python, Django, Java, Tomcat, Postgresql, Docker, G Suite, Digium Switchvox and production RHEL based Linux distributions.

The ideal candidate will have:
At least one year of relevant experience in a DevOps, TechOps, or SRE role.
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline is preferred, but not required.
He or she must possess exceptional verbal and written communication skills, an operations-oriented mindset, a knack for technical firefighting, diagnostics, troubleshooting and problem solving.
Knowledge of systems administration, software development life cycles, scripting and build tools.
Experience in managing and administering computer networks.
Knowledge of an object oriented programming language such as Python or Java.
Experience working in *NIX environments.
Familiarity with AWS.
Experience with macOS and Ubuntu in an office environment.
Proficiency in at least one scripting language. Bash or Python, but ideally both.
A desire to learn new technologies and evolve with an ever changing industry.
A willingness to help create and maintain an, Infrastructure As Code type environment.

Our culture rewards creative thinkers who are enthusiastic about their jobs with a great working environment and great benefits. A career with us will challenge you to be your absolute best!

title: Principal Engineer - Testing & Technology
description:
Apply

Description

Samson, the worldwide leader in high performance cordage, is seeking a Principal Engineer to join our team.

The Principal Engineer has responsibility to provide technical oversight, guidance and direction for the design, testing, product development and specification processes to meet company and customer needs and maintain integrity of Samson’s position as a technical leader in the industry. Sets and maintains strategy for lab test standards, equipment planned maintenance and machine upgrades to align with Samson strategic initiatives and business and service goals. Practice a high level of business ethics, professionalism, safety, and quality in all activities in accordance with Samson strategy and core values.
Plan, coordinate and manage assigned product development or R&D projects and coordinate testing as required.
Assist Engineers / Project Leaders in creating test plans and design of experiments to most effectively meet performance requirements and targets.
Provide engineering consultation, guidance and support to senior management for marketing and business development.
Define and manage Samson test methods and related test data management systems
Define and manage Samson’s product performance models to support the differentiation of Samson’s product performance and the management of product in-service life cycle.
Develop new test methods and related test equipment aligned with company strategic initiatives and customer needs.
Manage lab equipment upgrade and capability roadmap aligned with company strategic initiatives and growth plans.
Responsible for all laboratory test equipment, including ensuring personnel are trained to operate and employ all Safety and Operational requirements, maintaining calibrations, maintenance, trouble-shooting and repairs when required.
Support industry associations and workgroups as needed.
Be knowledgeable of and ensure that our products comply with or exceed all appropriate internal, Federal, State and other governing bodies’ specifications and/or regulations.
Help set and manage department goals and strategic plans, define measures of success, plan and manage budgets, and develop organizational capacity as necessary to achieve goals.
Participate in industry organizations to protect/drive Samson’s interest and enhance safety for the industry
Assure effective release/commercialization of new products.
Determine priorities for development of technical papers and articles for publication and/or presentation on behalf of the company’s products, testing and research efforts.
Provide technical training on products and core technologies to company personnel, customers and others as required.
Support team member development through effective hiring, mentoring/coaching, performance management, and training.
Periodically review new technologies and/or generate new ideas and explore new ideas to make constructive recommendations.
Travel to suppliers/partners to support joint projects/efforts as needed.
Negotiate contracts with 3rd party organizations for services and other resources as needed.
Responsible for continually maintaining a working knowledge and familiarity with Samson’s products, testing and knowledge of product performance (and supporting data management systems)
Perform other duties as assigned.
For 140 years, Samson has paved the road to success with innovation, quality, and service. Samson knows that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts: From our Corporate Headquarters and manufacturing in Ferndale, Washington, to the manufacturing floor in Lafayette, Louisiana, to our international sales teams, our people are what make the difference in the product and to the customer.

A career at Samson is challenging, rewarding, and satisfying. We accomplish our goals when each individual performs to their full potential while contributing as a valuable team player with others in the organization.

Samson offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k with company match, education reimbursement, PTO, education assistance, and 11 paid holidays.

We are a drug free, tobacco free workplace, and an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran).

Employment is contingent on a successful background and drug screen.

Requirements

Education

Required: Bachelors Degree in Engineering or related scientific area.

Desired: Masters Degree in Engineering or related scientific area.

Experience

Required: Six years engineering experience with a minimum of three years supervisory experience.

Desired: Three years or more experience with engineered/industrial products manufacturer.

Other required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Technical Expert – demonstrate knowledge and experience in rope design, testing methods, performance characterization and manufacturing techniques/equipment
Familiar with Industry standards and related organization
Good technical writing and oral presentation skills
Ability to build relationships at all levels in the organization as required by the position and to work well with a diverse group of individuals.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, have a strong attention to detail, and present information in a concise and effective way.
Ability to provide leadership, build teams, manage and develop staff.
Analytical, quantitative and statistical analysis skills.
Experience and ability to craft effective design of experiments
Proficient computer skills including use of Microsoft Office and ability to learn new programs.
Creative problem solving, with the ability to recommend and implement solutions.
Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
Mental & Physical Demands/Working Conditions:

Mental Effort:
Ensure that all activities conform to Company policies, and all appropriate laws and regulations.
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the Company. Exhibit a professional manner in dealing with others to maintain constructive working relationships.
Physical Requirements:
Prolonged sitting at a workstation.
Use of a telephone for extensive periods of time.
Lifting up to 10 pounds occasionally. May seldom lift up to 60 pounds.
Must be able to hear and perceive the nature of sounds by ear.
Specific vision abilities include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
Working Conditions:
Primarily working in an office environment with some exposure to manufacturing environment.
Must follow all safety guidelines as it relates to personal protective equipment when in the manufacturing facility.
Ability to travel approximately 10 - 40% of the time by air and to travel internationally requiring a passport.

title: Voice Network Engineer - TS/SCI cleared
description:
Company Overview

TestPros, Inc. is a successful and growing business, established in 1988 to provide Information Technology (IT) technical support services to a wide range of Commercial and U.S. Federal, State, and Local Government customers. Our capabilities include Program Management, Program Oversight, Process Audit, Intelligence Analysis, Cyber Security, NIST SP 800-171 Assessment and Compliance, Computer Forensics, Software Assurance, Software Testing, Test Automation, Section 508 and WCAG Accessibility Assessment, Localization Testing, Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V), Quality Assurance (QA), Compliance, and Research and Development (R&D) services. TestPros, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

TestPros, Inc. delivers innovative independent IT assessment solutions to critical challenges facing the nation and the world. We support the U.S. Federal Government and Commercial clients within the continental USA.

Job Summary

TestPros, Inc. is looking for an experienced Voice Network Engineer with communications activities including planning, designing, developing, testing, installing and maintaining large communications networks. In return, we offer challenging and exciting work environments and competitive compensation packages. For this contract, you will be located in the Miami, FL area.

This position requires full U.S. Citizenship, and an active/recent TS/SCI Clearance.

Responsibilities and Duties
Provides technical direction and engineering knowledge for communications activities including planning, designing, developing, testing, installing and maintaining large communications networks.
Ensures that adequate and appropriate planning is provided to direct building architects and planners in building communications spaces and media pathways meet standards.
Develops, operates, and maintains voice communications systems.
Designs, stages, configures, implements and support for VoIP installations as necessary.
Provides complex engineering or analytical tasks and activities associated with one or more technical areas within the communications function.
Analyzes problems and define solutions for existing voice communication issues.
Responds to troubleshoot and repair failures preventing customer access to critical applications throughout the organizations.
Diagnoses and resolves wiring problems.
Must have bachelor's degree and current CCNP.
Qualifications and Skills
Diagnostic skills not limited to the below functions:
Troubleshoot network issues quickly by identifying the sources of problems; hardware, software or network.
Must have good analytical and problem-solving skills to assess network performance and recommended changes.
Good interpersonal skills to communicate with network users and other information system professionals.
Project management skills to ensure that new installations or network upgrades do not disrupt normal work.
Benefits and Perks

TestPros, Inc. offers competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 3 weeks of paid time off, 2 weeks of paid holidays, education/training and professional certifications, 401(k) retirement plan with up to 4% company match, opportunities for professional growth, cell phone discounts, and much more! All benefits are per TestPros, Inc. current policies and are subject to change without notice. Benefits are available to full-time employees only.

For more information or to submit your resume, please "Apply Now" or email Careers@TestPros.com.

title: Field System Engineer
description:
World leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 50 years, bioMérieux conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems, reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety.

bioMérieux is present in over 150 countries through 43 subsidiaries and a large network of distributors. More than 90" of our sales are done internationally. Its corporate headquarters are located in Marcy l’Etoile, near Lyon, in France.

Joining bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic corporate culture.

We look for candidates whose motivation is to invest in themselves, in the projects of the future, and to participate in a collective adventure led by a pioneering spirit.

We have the commitment to offer our collaborators a working environment which encourages team spirit, with priority given to training and development with international career opportunities.

Our Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 10,000 bioMérieux employees who have already identified with these values!

The Field System Engineer will manage all service needs of their
assigned geographic base of customers. The activities include installation,
maintenance and repair of the instrument base within the assigned area, as well
as the administrative actions required to accurately reflect these activities.
Installation and Servicing 50>
Responds expediently to all requests for
customer instrument service via communications with service office;
ensures that all instrument service requests are fulfilled within area of
geographic responsibility.
Exercises judgment on service call
handling and deployment. Requests support when service call backlog
exists. This will be accomplished via communications with service center
and service management.
Installs instrumentation sold by
bioMérieux and assists customers in basic methods of operation,
maintenance and instrument repair procedures, while gaining systems and
applications knowledge.
Diagnosis and repair instrument
malfunctions to the board level and ensures that instruments operate
optimally in all performance areas.
Maintains accurate preventive maintenance
schedules and ensures timely completion of all scheduled maintenance
within area of geographic responsibility. During preventive maintenance
responsibilities include:
Probing customer for instrument or test
related problems and recommends a course of corrective action.
Performance of remedial/refresher training
in basic operation and maintenance of instrumentation.
Ensures a credible, professional service
image is established.
Promote the need and benefit of customer
service agreements.
Administrative Requirements 20>
Completes Instrument Service Reports and
Quality Assurance Checklists for each customer contact in order to
accurately document instrumentation, customer or test related problems.
Corrects problems encountered or formulates a corrective action plan which
is outlined for customer during time of contact.
Via Instrument Service Reports provides
accurate data for installation, warranty, instrumentation and customer
history documentation.
Documents recurring instrument/test
related failures and should include suggestions for changes or
modification to existing instrumentation, policies, manuals or concepts.
Completes all required departmental forms
including but not limited to Instrument Service Reports, Quality Assurance
Checklists, Preventive Maintenance/Verification Checklists, Repair Tags,
and Weekly Time Sheets and Travel Expense Statements and makes timely
submission in accordance with departmental policies and procedures.
Other Related Duties 30>
Maintains and controls spare parts
inventory at levels compatible with repair and financial objectives.
Ensures operating expenses fall within
departmental budgetary guidelines.
Continuously improves knowledge of
bioMérieux policies, instrumentation and service techniques while
improving interpersonal skills in an overall effort to ensure customer
satisfaction.
Provides necessary follow-up on service
agreement purchase to ensure achievement of departmental revenue
objectives.
Is responsible for care, maintenance and
safeguarding of all company issued property, i.e., car, test equipment,
tools and spare parts.
Adhere to all Standards of Performance and
meets all documented MBOs.
Qualifications:

Associate Degree or technical school
equivalent in Electronic Technology, Computer Science or equivalent
military training.
Must be proficient in computer operation
and basic computer repair.
Software operating systems experience
helpful.
Must be proficient in Windows and MS
Office, with knowledge of host/remote communications and network systems
preferred.
Require ability to work on mechanical, electrical
and vacuum systems.
Require experience in troubleshooting
skills, ability to travel with daily notice, experienced in resolving
customer problems and providing a high level of customer satisfaction.
Must have and maintain a valid drivers license.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer
M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Software Development Test Engineer II
description:
Responsibilities:
With minimal supervision, support one or more Agile teams as an advocate for quality and the customer experience
Own automated test coverage for one or more functional areas in the product(s) your product team is responsible for
Provide status updates and feedback to your team and manager
Learn and understand manual and automated testing policies and other QA documentation, and help to enforce and maintain them as needed
Assist less senior team members with learning/complying with policies
With minimal supervision, create automated test cases and suites against web applications and services, using ruby, Java, and/or .NET
With minimal supervision, spend up to 25% of your time also assisting with manual testing activities as needed
Perform more complex quality assurance/automated testing activities as needed
Implement test case automation for test cases as identified by manual and automated test engineers, maintaining test automation to a standard of coverage
Work with manual test engineers to identify test cases to automate, and with their feedback help senior SDETs to prioritize the automation work backlog
With minimal supervision, help to provision and maintain virtual machines for testing and perform other QA DevOps tasks as needed
Under guidance from senior engineers, help to build and improve QA tools and infrastructure
Contribute to and validate acceptance criteria
Contribute to story work estimates and sprint commitments
As needed, represent your product’s QA team with the larger product team
Other duties as assigned
The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with Cofense will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. Cofense reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

Qualifications:
A software quality engineer with three (3) or more years of experience in automated software testing in ruby, Java, and/or .NET, preferably with web applications and tools
Willing to learn new development languages, tools, and techniques
Self-motivated
Proficient at written and verbal communication, with English fluency in both
Able, as needed, to execute, report on, create, and maintain manual test cases
Familiar with software development in recent Windows and OS X operating systems using ruby and, ideally, at least one of Java and C#.NET
Familiar with testing using recent Windows and Apple operating systems
Familiar with testing web applications with popular web browsers (in particular, Internet Explorer, Chrome, and Firefox)
Familiar with using and maintaining local and remote virtual machines for testing
Familiar with both black box and white box testing
Able to perform browser and platform compatibility testing
Familiar using SQL with MySQL and/or PostgreSQL
Familiar with command-line tools under Linux, OS X, and/or Windows
Familiar with (when relevant):
Ruby: rvm, bundler, cucumber, rspec, FactoryGirl, and Selenium
Java: maven, cucumber, mockito/spock, and Selenium
.NET: specflow, nspec, and Selenium
Familiar with using git for working with repositories, including branching and merging
At least somewhat familiar with load and performance testing and/or testing for and at scale
At least somewhat familiar with Jenkins, Docker, and/or BrowserStack (or similar products/services)
Familiar with using issue tracking tools, especially JIRA, to manage work and report defects
Familiar with working on products through their release in an Agile/Scrum environment
Familiar with using system and/or interface design documentation
Able to deal with features with poor, outdated, or no design documentation
Able to work, with minimal supervision, on a distributed team, escalating issues as necessary
Willing to mentor other SDETs and QA engineers on development and test automation
Willing (if not happy!) to travel occasionally for team meetings and events (especially if you're remote)
Your experience should demonstrate that you:
Are a self-starter and a team player
Are detail-oriented
Understand the risks and opportunities offered by automated testing
Have previously worked on geographically distributed/remote teams
Will deal with ambiguity and change
Can take a task from information gathering to deployment and maintenance
Can take ownership of tasks and testing efforts as needed
Can mentor and supervise less experienced QA engineers
Will help your team document and make tradeoffs between quality and business needs
Are eager to learn, understand, and apply new things
View the developer/QA engineer relationship as collaborative, not adversarial
Like to work with people, not just computers
Are comfortable coloring outside the lines of your role (and comfortable with your teammates doing the same
Are interested in and stay on top of industry trends
Education and/ or Experience
The successful candidate will have three (3) or more years of relevant professional work experience writing automated tests in ruby, Java, and/or .NET, and will probably have additional experience with manual testing. Internships or professional jobs held as a student count towards this experience.
Had a bachelor’s degree (or more) and/or one or more professional certifications related to quality assurance, software development, or project management
Have experience with, testing involving e-mail, security testing, and Javascript testing
Have experience with customer service
Have contributed to the quality assurance/software engineering industry in some way: attended conferences, wrote papers, supported/have contributed to open source projects
Compensation
Competitive salary
401k with company match
Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
Telecom expense reimbursement
Choose your own Mac or Windows workstation
Peers that enjoy appropriate use of internet memes
Location
Leesburg, Virginia
Telecommute (United States only, if not in the Leesburg, VA area)
Cofense is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

title: Systems Engineer II - Windows
description:
Overview

WorldVentures, a dynamic, global, fast growing member based travel company, is currently sourcing for a Systems Engineer II to be based in our Plano, Texas headquarters. WorldVentures is a fast paced environment with a core of innovation and fun. If you are prepared to grow your career, wear multiple hats, and be part of a fast paced team with a focus on exceptional service, this may be the role for you.

The Systems Engineer is a member of WorldVentures Holdings Technical Operations team and is responsible for systems/applications in a dynamic global web-based company. This position will install, administer, and troubleshoot systems for high performance and reliability in cloud and virtual environments. This includes ensuring the availability of systems as well as developing procedures for ongoing management of the server environment. This position will work closely with the Sr Systems Engineer and Tech Ops management, as well as other functional groups to manage the company’s infrastructure.

Responsibilities
Engineer, administer, monitor, support, and troubleshoot servers, services, and applications in varying environments, primarily in AWS and vSphere
Perform compliance and security activities such as monthly patching (SCCM), backup/recovery management, log review, etc.
Connect with 3rd party vendor support and other company personnel for complex issue/problem/outage resolution
Create and maintain internal automation tasks, alerting, and reporting via PowerShell scripts
Serve as an escalation point for other Tech Ops teams (End User Computing, Production Support), including after-hours issues
Implement upgrades, enhancements, and fixes following change management procedures
Work with members of other departments to define requirements, examine options, scope solutions
Maintain technical standards; create and maintain documentation
Qualifications
4+ years’ experience with ownership/administration of production Windows server systems
Experience writing PowerShell scripts and deep knowledge of Windows Server and Active Directory
Experience supporting public-facing websites and associated services (certificate management, load balancers, DNS, etc.)
Knowledge of various server and cloud applications, such as: Office 365, software deployments with SCCM, Citrix XenDesktop management, etc.
Ability to accept assignments from senior members of the team and complete tasks in a timely manner
Superior attention to detail is required
Excel at making the workload and service process visible through ticket queues, documentation, etc.
Exhibit a willingness to learn new systems and skills. Must have a ‘can-do’ attitude and be able to tackle problems independently
Ability to build relationships with all employees, partners, vendors, customers
Additional Qualifications Desired
Related Certifications (MCSE/MCSA, VCP, ITIL, AWS, etc.)
Experience/education with Amazon Web Services, VMware vSphere, Linux
Administrative or development experience in ServiceNow or SharePoint
WorldVentures is a privately held company based in Plano, Texas with active representatives and members in over 28 countries. WorldVentures proudly offers competitive salaries and benefits including but not limited to Medical, Dental, Vision, Life / AD&D, FSA, 401K and a robust vacation and holiday package. In addition, all full time employees automatically receive a WorldVentures membership at no cost to allow employees access to our exclusive DreamTrips group travel experiences.

title: GIS Software Engineer
description:
WR Systems has a potential need for a GIS software engineer for the design of geospatial / geographical information systems (GIS) using advanced programming languages.

Position responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:
Geospatial based software design with emphasis on:
o graphical user interface
o vector based mapping
o raster based mapping.

Candidates must possess the following knowledge, skills, and experience:
Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer/Software Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, or related Scientific discipline.
A minimum of six (6)+ years of experience is desired.
Must be able to demonstrate a strong proficiency of advanced programming concepts such as:
o object oriented programming,
o design patterns
o multi-threading
o inter-process communication
o buffering
o persistence
o modeling and simulation.
Should have a strong background in data filtering, present time filtering, future time predictions, and interpolation smoothing methods.
Must be capable of conducting performance tuning and debugging. Experience with Electronic Nautical Charts (ENCs), S-100, ECDIS-N, and/or Digital Nautical Charts (DNCs) a strong plus.

Desired:
Certifications:

o OS - Linux and Windows
o Languages – C / C++ / ASP / .NET / .NET Core / Mono
o GUI – HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Typescript
o Network Centric Framework
o Cyber Security
o Software Documentation & Training

Ability to obtain and maintain an Secret Security Clearance.

*This position is contingent upon funding.

The selected candidate will support the organization's mission, vision, and values by exhibiting the following behaviors: high standard of quality in conduct and performance; determination to achieve excellence; ownership; accountability; competence; collaboration; innovation; focus; drive; enthusiasm; mutual trust and respect; dedication; loyalty; and good citizenship.

W R Systems, Ltd. has a proven track record of high employee retention. We have been providing engineering, science and systems innovations, support and solutions to Public and Private sector since 1983. We encourage individual growth and provide a flexible work schedule with competitive benefit package. We acknowledge individual and group achievements through awards, bonuses, and various other formal and informal methods.

W R Systems, Ltd., is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, marital status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any additional factors that are protected by law.

title: Software Engineer
description:
ENGIE Insight, formerly Ecova, partners with multi-site businesses that aim to thrive in a sustainable world. With a foundation of accurate and comprehensive resource data – including energy, water, waste and telecom – we apply technology and people expertise to lower costs, drive efficiencies and reduce environmental impact. More than 1,000 customers, including 25" of the Fortune 500, turn to ENGIE Insight to help move their sustainable resource management initiatives forward.

ENGIE Insight’s people are our greatest strength, bound by our vision to enable a sustainable world where people, organizations and the environment thrive. We are passionate about making our company and the world a better place; responsible in working with commitment and accountability; collaborative with our colleagues and clients, and agile enough to work in a dynamic, changing industry.

The wide-ranging expertise of our diverse team fuels the innovation that places us on the leading edge of the energy industry. As such, we nurture a company culture—through training, mentoring and professional development—that encourages all employees to thrive. If this the kind of place you see yourself working, we invite you to join ENGIE Insight.

*In order to be considered for the role, your resume must be attached in your application.

Position Summary

Designs and creates new software by analyzing requirements and implementing and testing programming applications in support of Energy Data Management. Significant ingenuity and latitude is expected.

Role Description
Responsibilities include one or more of the following (depending upon the specific role):
Work closely with UX designers to design and implement innovative and robust client-side software applications
Design and develop server-side code for web-based, SaaS software applications
Design and develop¬ software subsystems that communicate in real time to external services using Web Services and/or APIs
Modify existing database schemas by adding, changing, and/or removing fields in existing database schemas
Utilize object-orient design patterns in the implementation of reusable, performant, and secure components
Build software applications that are deployed in a cloud-based, virtual environment
Complete testing tasks for all developed code


Role Competencies

• Computer Science BS/MS degree
3 years of software development experience
Cloud development experience (AWS, Azure, OpenStack, etc.)
Experience with Big Data technologies.
Experience building / consuming REST APIs.
Experience with high throughput, scalable, systems

Required Skills\Abilities:

title: Project Manager / Engineer
description:
Project Manager / Engineer
Shickel Corporation is growing and seeks a Project Manager to oversee the execution and management of custom metal fabrication projects primarily in the construction industry.

At Shickel Corporation, our vision is to be the most trusted name in the design, fabrication, and installation of custom metal products. To accomplish this we need to recruit and develop the right people who thrive on challenges and desire to continually improve.

We are a custom metal fabricator that specializes in ornamental metals. Our custom work environment creates an ever-changing day-to-day work experience. We design, fabricate and install unique projects including monumental stairs, architectural metal, historical building renovations, museum exhibits, and products used in the food and pharmaceutical industries.

This is a fantastic opportunity to start, establish, or complete your career with a company that invests in their co-workers. We maintain a culture that places an emphasis on family-oriented values and teamwork. Not only does Shickel Corporation provide training to grow your skills and knowledge in this diverse and challenging market, but we also offer an industry-leading benefits package. Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Employee Assistance Program, Educational Assistance, Flex Spending Account, 401K matching, Personal leave time, paid Holidays, and Disability.

All Project Managers are based out of our Bridgewater, VA location. The vast majority of projects are located close enough for day trips, providing the added bonus of a career in the construction industry without bouncing around from city to city.

Representing Shickel Corporation as the key point of contact with customers
Project control from conception to completion
100% detailed, hands-on knowledge of the project scope

Solid understanding of construction processes, sequences, and codes
Cost control, cash flow, and change management
Support & encourage co-workers to continually improve themselves and the company

Experience in the construction industry
Experience in the steel industry

Robust work ethic

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Summary/Objective
The Embedded Software Engineer will be responsible for executing design and development of advanced embedded engineering products. The goal is to create scalable and optimized software system architectures. Focus for this position will be on production software implementations and repeatable, reliable deployments of product software in a production environment.
Essential Functions
•Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment.
•Design, develop, code, test and debug system software.
•Review code and design.
•Analyze and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources.
•Integrate and validate new product designs.
•Support software QA and optimize I/O performance.
•Provide post production support.
•Interface with hardware design and development.
•Assess third party and open source software.
•Assist in Code/Voxx Automotive growth through the Goal Planning process and individually driven goals.
•Using the Code/Voxx Automotive internal Product Development Lifecycle system, create and deliver appropriate files with all documentation required to support IATF 16949.
•Comply with company and department policies, procedures, guidelines and standards.
•Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
•Assist in the development and continuing improvement efforts to establish Code/Voxx Automotive and the engineering Department as World Class in the industry.
Preferred Education
•Bachelors’ Degree Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering or relevant experience.
•Minimum of 3 years industry experience or combination of education and experience.

Desired Skills
•32-bit Microcontroller experience.
•Basic knowledge in Bluetooth application development.
•Basic knowledge in CAN stacks and tools (e.g. Vehicle Spy, CANalyzer).
•Experience developing with LabVIEW.
•Experience with simple Windows application development.
•Scripting languages such as Perl or Python.
•Experience with unit testing frameworks.


Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
•Proven working experience in software engineering.
•Experience in hands-on development and troubleshooting on embedded targets.
•Solid programming experience in C or C++.
•Proven experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems.
•Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools, and peer review.
•Familiarity with OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems.
•Adequate knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components.
•Strong documentation and writing skills.
Must be able to demonstrate the following attributes: Adaptability, flexibility, excellent organization skills, multitasking, and possess strong analytical and excellent communication skills.
•Must have the ability to learn computer applications, as necessary, for the position.
•Must have the ability to develop solutions for moderate to complex problems or systems.
•Excellent time management, problem solving, organizational, and verbal and written communication skills.

Code Systems/VOXX Automotive offers all full-time employees’ medical, dental, vision (company fully pays vision), 401(k), life insurance, short-term disability and long-term disability.
VOXX International is an EOE.

title: Lead Python Engineer in Research
description:
The Team

This role will be working in our Fixed Income Research Engineering team. Our developers are responsible for designing and implementing proprietary systems and tools that drive the quantitative strategy research and implementation that powers AQR. Our development teams are small, motivated, and highly productive. Collaborating side-by-side with researchers and portfolio analysts, you will become intimately familiar with the investment philosophy which drives AQR.

Your Role

As a software engineer in Fixed Income research you will build or extend our:
Proprietary portfolio construction and optimization techniques
Intuitive research APIs leveraging cloud computing and cutting-edge visualizations
High-performance historical simulation engine
Workflow platform using services, messaging, and graph-based dependency awareness
What You'll Bring
Outstanding coding and debugging skills in Python
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related discipline
Strong technical background especially in architecture and design
Strength in pragmatic design and deploying applications using Linux/Docker/Python
Should be able to communicate designs, prioritize and manage others.
Who You Are
Mature, thoughtful, and a natural fit for a collaborative, team-oriented culture
Hard-working and eager to learn in a fast-paced, innovative environment
Committed to intellectual integrity, transparency, and openness
Motivated by the transformational effects of technology-at-scale
We believe that the next innovation to transform our business could come from anyone at AQR. Expect to be recognized not only for your diligence and hard work today, but for your vision for tomorrow. We are mathematicians, computer scientists, engineers and artists, passionate about advancing financial research and pushing the limits of today's technology.

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

title: Systems Development - Firmware Engineer / Research & Development (Min. 2 years' experience)
description:
World leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 50 years, bioMérieux conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems, reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety.

bioMérieux is present in over 150 countries through 43 subsidiaries and a large network of distributors. More than 90> of our sales are done internationally. Its corporate headquarters are located in Marcy l’Etoile, near Lyon, in France.

Joining bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic corporate culture.

We look for candidates whose motivation is to invest in themselves, in the projects of the future, and to participate in a collective adventure led by a pioneering spirit.

We have the commitment to offer our collaborators a working environment which encourages team spirit, with priority given to training and development with international career opportunities.

Our Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 10,000 bioMérieux employees who have already identified with these values!

The R&D Engineer – Embedded Software and Firmware is a technical position, expected to play a collaborative role in embedded software and firmware engineering design activities developing complex medical diagnostic equipment. This person would have an interest in embedded control system concepts with a background in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, with conceptual knowledge of Real-Time Operating Systems or multi-threaded applications.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Contribute hands-on to component concept, design, development, and support activities.

- Coordinate, with the other technical disciplines, integration activities of complex electro-mechanical instruments.

- Develop functional and design requirements for new system functionalities and features and ensure that all designs are properly documented.

- Participate in technical design and code reviews.

- Collaborate and produce technical output as part of a team of ten or more Embedded Software and Firmware engineers.

- Follow best practices in engineering design, utilizing Embedded Software and Firmware engineering theories, methods and research techniques.

- Apply object-oriented design principles during .

- Develop, document, and test firmware in C and C using classical object-oriented design principles.

- Create appropriate technical documentation, including technical reports and lab notebook unit tests as required.

- Comply with design control guidelines and Quality requirements within the company’s regulated ISO\FDA environment.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

- Bachelor of Science degree, preferably in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.

- A minimum of 2 years' of professional experience developing application software or embedded application software.

- Proficient in use of Development & Debug Environments, Source Control Repositories and Code Comparison Tools.

- Proficient in C , fluent in object-oriented design principles.

- Interest in embedded systems and concepts (real-time operating systems, motor control, USB, I2C, SPI). Prior workplace experience with these NOT required.

- Working knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools – primarily Excel, Word and Outlook, but also Visio, One-Note, PowerPoint and Project.

DESIRED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

- Experience writing software running on microcontrollers controlling complex electromechanical equipment, embedded hardware controls, automation or robotic systems.

- Experience with NXP Kinetis-based or ARM-based microcontrollers.

- Experience with Micrium uC/OS-III real-time operating system and other Micrium stacks.

- Experience with the CAN and CAN-Open protocol.

- Experience with code metric analysis tools (static analysis, SonarQube, etc.).

- Experience with automated unit test development and unit testing frameworks (bonus points for unit testing embedded software applications).

- Experience with automated build environments.

- Experience working in an ISO/FDA regulated environment.

bioMérieux is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Software Engineer II-IV
Systems Engineer
description:
Become a part of the family, become a TaxSlayer!

At TaxSlayer our products radically transform the way people use technology, allowing them to spend less time on the things they have to do and more on what they want to do! TaxSlayers strive for excellence in all they do, whether partnering with non-profits or building cool new stuff. Collectively, TaxSlayers strive to acknowledge their C.U.R.B. appeal, with a focus on being Customer-obsessed, Unified, Responsible, and Bold.

TaxSlayer is looking for a talented professional to join our growing IT Division as a Systems Engineer. This position is responsible for management, administration and maintenance of the Windows server environment based on Microsoft technologies such as Windows Server 2008/2008 R2/2012/2012 R2, WDS, and Office 365. You will manage Windows server applications and interoperability within a larger, heterogeneous production environment requiring 24 X 7 uptime. As part of the Systems Engineer team, you will be involved in implementation and planning of complex projects involving advanced technologies to include, but not limited to, Windows Failover Clustering, Active Directory, ADFS, Group Policy, Hyper-V, Shared Storage (SANs, NASs, and other iSCSI targets), Multi-Site Failover Clusters, and Private and Public Clouds.

Principal Responsibilities
Proposes and implements system enhancements (software and hardware updates) that will improve the performance and reliability of the server applications
Manage server applications including:
Active Directory and Group Policy
Active Directory Federated Services
Internet Information Services
File Servers and Storage Spaces
Sharepoint
Office 365
Additional Proprietary and Internally Developed Applications
Manage Windows server infrastructure including:
IIS
Message Queuing
DNS
DHCP
Windows Deployment Services
ADFS
Active Directory and other supported Windows applications
Install, maintain, upgrade and patch Windows operating systems and applications
Performs daily administration of computer systems (servers) to prevent outage and plans for optimized system resource utilization
Maintains integrity and reliability of server through the development of procedures and standards
Automates routine maintenance tasks as appropriate
Work with developers to optimize system resource utilization
Provides server/systems related assistance to other departments as needed
Trains other employees on system
Other job duties as assigned
Minimum QualificationsOur Must Haves
Intermediate to Advanced Powershell scripting knowledge for automating server administration tasks is mandatory
BS in Computer Science or related field of study preferred (may be substituted with Equivalent Experience)
4 Years of Windows System Administration experience
Needed Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Extensive knowledge of Windows operating systems and environments
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Proven experience dealing with critical customer facing applications
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks at a time
Strong experience with Active Directory
Strong troubleshooting skills
Strong experience with performance monitoring and tuning
Good networking fundamentals
Bonus Qualifications
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Server Infrastructure
Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate: Office 365
Security certifications
More About TaxSlayer

TaxSlayer makes life simpler and less stressful for millions of Americans with exceptional, easy-to-use technology. Trusted for over 50 years, TaxSlayer saves business owners, tax professionals, and individual consumers time and money with high-quality, high-value, financial products. In addition to offering the top-rated tax preparation software, support, and tools, TaxSlayer's products are radically transforming the legal, bookkeeping, and HR/payroll arenas, helping small business owners better serve their customers.

TaxSlayer offers its employees a comprehensive benefits package to include healthcare, dental and vision care, and 401(k). Our employees also enjoy great company perks like education assistance, a child college fund, and endless cups of coffee. Plus, TaxSlayer loves sports, so we sponsor numerous athletes and host our own NCAA Bowl game called the TaxSlayer Gator Bowl. Want to work here? We understand. Apply with us today!

TaxSlayer provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Vibration Analyst/Engineer
description:
Bechtel Plant Machinery, Inc. (BPMI) is seeking a vibration analyst/engineer.

Perform vibration data collection, data analysis, software modeling and programming, and engineering evaluations for Flow Control Equipment and other assigned tasks supporting the Fleet Pump Support Unit.
Perform routine and emergent data collection on-board submarines and aircraft carriers to support fleet needs and machinery health assessments.
Evaluate machinery health and condition of Reactor Coolant Pumps and other rotating equipment, through detailed analysis of vibration data.
Develop software modelling and programs to maintain and expand vibration data analysis library to improve ability to process data.
Perform troubleshooting of equipment and instrumentation related to data collection systems.
Develop, procure, and maintain equipment to support testing and data collection, including ownership of information technology program requirements.
Interface with key stakeholders including government personnel, Squadron, Ships Force, and Shipyard to effectively plan and execute data collection trips.

B.S. or M.S. degree in Engineering from an accredited college or university.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 is preferred.
Minimum of two years experience.
Travel (10-25%) to support fleet data collection.
Experience interfacing with internal teams and external vendors or suppliers.
Experience or interest in computer programming and simulation software (e.g., MATLAB, LabVIEW).
Experience with logistics, technical manuals, shipping, and funding.
Knowledge of vibration data and analysis techniques.
Must be a U.S. citizen due to government security clearance requirements. In order to work at BPMI, applicants must complete a Federal background investigation and be granted a security clearance.
BPMI is a prime contractor for the United States Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program (NNPP). We are a project engineering organization responsible for providing design, manufacturing, and procurement management for the fabrication, testing, delivery, installation, and field support of high quality nuclear power plant components for installation in submarines and aircraft carriers.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:
Competitive Health Care, Dental, and Vision
Defined Contribution Retirement Plans
401(k) Plan with company match
Capital Accumulation Plan (CAP) with company contribution
Flexible Spending Accounts
9/80 work schedule option
Competitive Vacation and Holidays
Tuition Reimbursement
Continuing Education and Training
Equal Opportunity Employer: minority/female/disabled/veteran

title: Principal CloudOps Engineer
description:
Principal CloudOps Engineer

Location: Bethesda, MD

WealthEngine (WE) is seeking a Principal CloudOps Engineer to collaborate with a group of elite software architects and engineers to design and build the next generation SaaS platform using advanced Data Engineering and Data Science technology. Our technology powers the campaigns of some of the biggest non-profits, universities, financial service firms, and luxury brands in the country. Using actionable wealth and lifestyle insights, WE fuel's highly-targeted campaigns that continuously deliver measured outcomes. The WE platform is powered by more than half a trillion data points and uses proprietary learning science to create WE profiles for more than 250M people in the US.

If you are passionate about designing and implementing DevOps, CloudOps, CI/CD pipelines as a code, designing automated deployments and migrating from legacy environments to agile methods using cutting edge DevOps & CloudOps tools, and have excellent communication skills, then we want to talk with you right away!

Here's what you'll do:
Help drive the transformation from legacy process to a true DevOps/CloudOps organization enhancing automation and maturing our CI/CD processes
Lead and participate in architecture, design, and development of DevOps/CloudOps projects, select and maintain tools, configuration, and scripts
Assist in the development and implementation of security best practices and initiatives at all levels of the cloud infrastructure
Automate application deployments across multiple environments (Dev, QA, Staging, & Prod) as part of an Agile SDLC while following established team workflows
Act as second level engineering support for incidents, understanding technical interdependencies for end-to-end problem solving, engaging third party tier-1 support organization, as well as application teams and our cloud services and SaaS providers for troubleshooting and problem solving
Refine and implement methods and solutions for monitoring and controlling spend on platforms in the cloud
Ensure maximum uptime of cloud-hosted environments, including production, staging, testing, authoring, and development environments
Size AWS environments to provide stability and performance as required by the application's tier level and criticality. Periodic assessment of AWS expenditures and recommendations for capacity planning, pre-payments, or other cost reduction options
Along the way, you will also:
Serve as a subject matter expert for system specific issues, processes, and regulations
Collaborate and work cross-functionally in designing and building our marque product
Participate in company training and professional development opportunities and also in our parties and picnics!
What We're Looking for In You
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of relevant education, training, and experience
5+ years of experience supporting Development, Testing and Production infrastructure especially in a SaaS environment using Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Prior experience as a CloudOps Architect or Senior Engineer required
Hands on experience in designing, building, and maintaining DevOps/Cloudops pipelines, including CI/CD and blue-green deployments
Prior experience in developing, implementing, and continuously improving the use of monitoring tools, including CloudWatch, Nagios, LogicMonitor, New Relic, AppDynamic, DataDog, and Splunk
Hands on experience with AWS VPC networking and security, creating subnets, Setting up peering, ACL's and VPN tunnels, AWS products such as S3, ELB, RDS, CloudFormation, EC2, VPCs, and networking components
Experience with modern automation and orchestration technologies such as Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, GIT, Jenkins, Maven, Ant, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, etc. is a must
Solid understanding of fundamental technologies like DNS, Load Balancing, SSL, TCP/IP, networking, security best practices, performance, high availability, disaster recovery, and business continuity
Experienced in analyzing and resolving server performance, scalability and reliability issues
Proficient in scripting in one or more programming languages (Python, Ruby, Perl, PowerShell, Bash)
Working experience in a wide variety of databases, including both relational databases and NoSQL databases such as Cassandra (preferred), MongoDB, Oracle, or Elasticsearch
Knowledge of Scrum process and tools such as Jira Confluence
Experience in systems management roles in a production environment for a highly-trafficked internet site
A well-organized, action-oriented team player with the ability to prioritize daily work, change directions quickly, work with geographically dispersed cross-functional virtual teams, and work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to take full ownership of projects and services, assembling virtual teams as needed, and providing leadership to the virtual team
Excellent written and oral communications skills to both technical and business audiences
Knowledge of HIPAA and SOC 2 compliance is a plus
AWS Certification preferred
Perks
Medical/Dental/Vision and Flex Spending Account
Paid holidays and vacation
401k plan
Parking or public transportation travel allowance
Lots more!
How to Get This Job

If you would like this story to be yours, send us a copy of your resume and a letter telling us why you would be the ideal fit for this role. We think your ability to communicate in writing is very important, so we'll read your letter first.

This is a full-time position in our downtown Bethesda, MD office (easy access from Metro's Red Line).

title: Process Control Engineer
description:
Delek US Holdings, Inc. is a diversified downstream energy company with assets in petroleum refining, logistics, renewable fuels and convenience store retailing. The refining assets consist of refineries operated in Tyler and Big Spring, Texas, El Dorado, Arkansas and Krotz Springs, Louisiana with a combined nameplate crude throughput capacity of 302,000 barrels per day.

The logistics operations primarily consist of Delek Logistics Partners, LP. Delek US Holdings, Inc.and its affiliates own approximately 63% (including the 2 percent general partner interest) of Delek Logistics Partners, LP. Delek Logistics Partners, LP (NYSE:DKL) is a growth-oriented master limited partnership focused on owning and operating midstream energy infrastructure assets.

The convenience store retail business is the largest 7-Eleven licensee in the United States and operates approximately 300 convenience stores in central and west Texas and New Mexico.

Role Summary

The Process Control Engineer will work as part of our Process Control team that supports the Refinery’s process control programs and systems in direct support of refinery operations. This role is responsible for implementing standard and complex process control solutions to successful completion while focusing on continuous improvement of customer satisfaction, quality and safety performance. The position is also responsible for implementing overall control system strategy within the refinery as part of a team and assist in developing, implementing, testing and maintaining innovative technical solutions. This role works in conjunction with process stakeholders to evaluate process operating performance, implements ideas for optimization, and champions projects in support of long term sustainable profitability and performance. The Process Control Engineer will interface closely with process engineering, operations, reliability, project engineering and maintenance and is responsible for executing work safely to the standards and procedures by the industry, company and refinery.

Job Accountabilities
The position requires a strong team player, someone who is self-motivating with a positive “can do” attitude.
Specific duties include design and implementation of process control configurations, tuning control loops, troubleshooting control opportunities and related process control engineer/specialist functions in the DCS and in safety instrumented systems.
Abilities to multi-tasks and communicate technical concepts and solutions effectively and at a high level.
Knowledge of Networking, virtualization and MS security is a plus. Knowledge of instrumentation installation, specification sheets, calibration, calculations and configurationChampion projects, and programs that support refinery vision.
Ensure process safety, safety, and environmental compliance by supporting process hazard analysis, incident investigations, procedure development, management of change, alarm management, pressure protection management, and providing technical assistance for work scope development, assessment of process impacts on equipment, and environmental reviews
Provide process control technical assistance to process operations for solving operating problems, optimizing, and improving production planning
Support turnaround and unit shutdown planning and execution through participation in scope development, providing justification for work items, and providing technical support outage timeframe
Support capital project development, define project scopes, complete project estimates, and support design and construction
Review projects for technical accuracy and clarity and deliver presentations as required to support project updates, justification, and explanation
Other duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Controls Engineering or related technical field or equivalent specific process control specialist experience in a plant environment
Three (3) or more years of experience in engineering or process control systems working in a chemical or refining plant environment
Understanding of alarm management principles
Demonstrated technical experience with process control project execution
Knowledge of Delta V, Honeywell or other DCS platforms
Experience implementing traditional DCS projects and conversions both DCS and SIS
High level of understanding of and experience with process control systems including safety instrumented systems, DCS, PLC’s and process control networks.
Knowledgeable of Advanced Process Control applications
Demonstrate practical application of engineering, and mathematical principles to refinery or chemical processes and unit operations.
Ability to effectively use structured approaches in problem solving and troubleshooting.
Capability of producing results in both a team and individual environment.
Demonstrate passion and tenacity for improvement of self, others, and refinery performance.
Exhibits a working knowledge of policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.
Advanced Computer skills: ability to access, navigate, learn, and use application software such as Microsoft Office, Excel, data acquisition/historian programs, alarm management, and quality control lab systems. Solid verbal and written communication and technical writing skills
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Ability to interact effectively and positively with all levels of Company personnel
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Strong attention to detail
Ability to anticipate and adapt to dynamic situations
Must pass drug test and background check
Must be a US citizen
Desired Characteristics
Eight (8) years or more years of experience in engineering or process control systems working in a chemical or refining plant environment
Advanced understanding of oil refining processes (FCC, Reforming, hydrotreating, crude distillation, extraction, blending operations)
Demonstrated experience in development and implementation of process control strategy, automation philosophy, or advance process control applications
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans.

Nearest Major Market: El Dorado
Job Segment:
Controls Engineer, Process Engineer, Chemical Research, Construction, Engineer, Engineering

title: V&V Analyst/Engineer V
description:
AMEWAS, Inc., a growing Department of Defense (DoD)/ Federal Contractor, is seeking highly motivated and talented V&V Analyst/Engineer V to support the Simulation Division.

Location: Patuxent River, Maryland: Best Places for Tech Jobs (#4); to learn more about our surrounding location, please visit http://www.visitstmarysmd.com.

A typical day as a V&V Analyst/Engineer V may include:
Supports AMEWAS V&V team member for the Integrated Battlespace Simulation & Test (IBST) Department/Modeling and Simulation (M&S) division for the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter (JSF) Joint Simulation Environment (JSE).
Supports daily communications with V&V customers/SME’s, JSE Development Team representatives, and supporting sub-contractors (i.e.: IDA, BGI, and GTRI).
Support duties as the V&V JSE Threat and Friendly (TAF) Functional Team Lead (FTL) to include: --Reviews Intelligence reports for aircraft weapons for requirements development.
-Develops F-35 JSE/TAF V&V plans, reports, data collection plans, data gap analysis, and risk assessment documentation.

-Develops Validation Test Design (VTD), Validation Test and Analysis Plans (VTAP) and reporting documents for F-35 JSE component/system level evaluation.

-Supports development of JSE Test Plans and Test Cards for event execution.

-Conducts/attends Planning and Reporting Team (PRT) meetings, Data Working Groups (DWG’s), and Technical Interchange Meetings (TIM’s) as required.
Supports as F-35 Test/Resource Manager during V&V chamber testing events.
Provides technical inputs and develops presentations materials for customers as required.
Qualifications and Experience:
Minimum of 10-12 years of relevant experience or acceptable educational substitution
DoD Secret security clearance
Education and Certifications:
BS in Engineering or Science
This position is classified as AMEWAS labor category LC Engineer.

AMEWAS participates with E-Verify to confirm eligibility to work in the United States.

AMEWAS Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Soft Skills & Competencies Required:

Customer-focused attitude with high level of professionalism and discretion. Ability to work effectively with management and part of a team to meet targets. Is reliable, possesses initiative, and works well as an individual or part of a team.

Physical Environment and Working Conditions:

The physical environment requires the employee to work in an office, sitting in a cubicle or at a desk, looking at a computer for most of the workday. Work is physically comfortable. The employee has discretion about walking, standing, etc.

The employee may be required to walk short distances to offices/conference rooms and buildings on site. In some occasions, the employee may be required to drive to offices or buildings near the work site. In rare occasions, travel may be required.

About the Organization

AMEWAS, Inc. is a small, Veteran owned company that has been providing excellent technical, engineering, administrative, and management services to the Department of Defense for more than 35 years. At AMEWAS we understand the need for a successful work/life balance and are focused not just on fulfilling customers’ needs, but ensuring our employees are a top priority as well.

Staying connected to our core values sets us apart from our competition! AMEWAS easily recognizes and rewards performance, dedication, and longevity. We are committed to investing in our employees and their future by providing them with competitive compensation, career development, optimum working conditions, and unique benefits.

AMEWAS has 4.8/5 stars on Glassdoor! Check out our reviews HERE and see what other job seekers have to say!

Our excellent benefits and perks include:
