title: Senior Android Software Engineer
description:
Job Summary

As the industry’s most respected video processing and switching company, RGB Spectrum looks for the world’s best and brightest engineers. Come leverage RGB Spectrum’s world-class talent and technology and make the impact in next generation video switching that you have always wanted to accomplish, with a team that you can count on.

In this highly visible role, you will be a vital member of a very dynamic and focused team as we create and roll out new products and features to enhance our powerful video processing and delivery system. You will be specifying, designing and creating products as the team brings to market the industry leading switching and video processing architecture of our next generation Control Room devices.

Responsibilities

Will include, but are not limited to:
Specifying, planning, designing and implementing to delivery products and features which form several aspects of inter-dependent products and features.
Working with sub-contractors working on related projects.
Driving the design and implementation of the components.
Participating in the definition of the requirements and introduction to manufacturing.
Mentoring more junior engineering team members.
Job Requirements, Education and Training
BS or MS in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering required with 6+ years of experience in Android network system implementation.
Proven track record in implementing projects from conception to introduction and deployment.
Software development experience with strong coding skills is essential.
Software development experience with Android is essential, Windows and linux experience highly desirable.
Experience with video processing and management highly desirable.
Experience with at least one of the following protocols and standards: H.264, HDCP, IPV, HDMI, DisplayPort, TDMA is required.
Experience in Architecture model / modeling development and system validation is considered a plus.
Experience with Layer 2 and/or Layer 3 technologies like Ethernet, IPv4/IPv6 is a strong advantage.
Ideal candidate has systems background with some chip background (S/W or H/W) in Network Switching and Video Switching industry.
About the Company

RGB Spectrum provides innovative solutions for the display, recording, and transmission of computer and video signals. Since its founding in 1987, RGB Spectrum has established itself as a leading designer and manufacturer of cutting-edge video/graphics processors and decision support systems.

Company offerings include multiviewers, video wall processors, matrix switchers, codecs, recorders, and integrated solutions for control room management. RGB Spectrum's products are preferred by major global organizations in industrial, security, medical, educational, commercial, and military markets.

At RGB Spectrum, you will join a growing team of talented professionals, and be a part of an industry-leading organization that has a long history of innovation.

We offer all the advantages of working in a smaller, more personalized environment. Each employee can make a difference and directly contribute to the success of the company.

The company provides a first class, modern building in Alameda, with quick access to all East Bay freeways. Our central location is convenient for shopping, restaurants, parks, and beaches, and also puts you just minutes from San Francisco and Berkeley.

We offer full benefits including 401(k), medical/dental/vision, FSA, HSA, tuition reimbursement, commuter benefits and competitive compensation package.

This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. But, it is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.

title: Professional Services Engineer - Contract to hire
description:
Professional Services Engineer

We are currently recruiting for a Professional Services Engineer for our Verticomm division. Your primary responsibility will be as a Project Engineer in a fast paced operations environment with some tier-3 support work. You’ll need a solid background in supporting Citrix and VDI Horizon. A customer service mindset is essential. You’ll support a diverse base of customers, including non-technical users. The ability to communicate in non-technical terms will be essential. We believe there is tremendous opportunity for someone with the right skills to excel within our company.

Responsibilities:

Tools:
BitTitan/MigrationWiz/Deployment Pro experience

Services:
Office 365, Mimecast, MS Exchange (2010-2016) and Active Directory. Support, configuration and deployment experience.
Should be able to show a history of working directly on email migration projects specifically migrations from on-prem exchange to O365. Project experience should include history of working with end users/computers and coordinating all steps (seed/migration/cutover).
Work with the professional services team to work a variety of projects from on-boarding new premise based customers and cloud customers to building servers and customized high-end workstations
Conduct network audits and assist in the development of technology road maps to meet and anticipate client needs

This position offers a competitive salary between 67-85k as well as a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, paid time off, paid holidays, company paid life insurance and a 401k with a generous company match, company incentives and activities.

Successful Candidate Competencies:
Self-driven engaging Engineer with a proven history of demonstrated technical skills and leadership
Strong communication skills to effectively drive recommendations and priorities across customers, partners, and the organization
Analyze complex IT business needs presented and recommend technical solutions; solve basic and complex IT malfunctions and performs troubleshooting

title: Building Engineer
description:
Job Title

Building Engineer

Job Description Summary

Responsible for ensuring the efficient operation and maintenance of mechanical and/or electrical equipment for assigned property.

Job Description

Job Description

Responsibilities
Perform all plumbing, electrical, or HVAC requirements of the building(s)
Maintain heaters, chillers, pumps, fan coil units, etc.
Monitor and adjust all mechanical/pneumatic equipment, control gauges, distributor panels, valves, thermostats, diffusers, and other equipment necessary to provide a comfortable environment for the buildings
Monitor Energy Management
Repair doors, ceilings, hand railings, and floors
Perform preventive maintenance duties, including changing filters, oiling motors, replacing light fixtures, Inspecting and adjusting belts, replacing motor bearings, aligning shafts and annual inspections as directed by manufacturers
Inspect engine room equipment, fan room equipment, cooling tower, all motors, house pumps, and sump pumps
Document and report activities to supervisor
Respond immediately to emergency situations (fire, evacuation, equipment failure, etc.) and customer concerns
Comply with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agency, and company directives as relates to building operations and practice safe work habits
Requirements
Graduate of apprentice program or trade school
2+ years of related work experience in operating mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in a commercial property setting
Appropriate license/permit for trade as may be required, i.e. Journeyman or Master Electrician License or City Licenses or any similar combination of education and experience
May be required to have certification as a Universal Technician for CFCs depending on market licensure requirements
Basic computer skills required
Possess and maintain a valid drivers license and good driving record with periodic checks
Background checks may be required by client
Proven record of providing excellent internal and external customer service
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
May be only maintenance staff member on duty during certain shifts; may be required to work extended periods of time without relief when responding to priority/emergency situations (including overtime type assignments); may require shift work and/or on call duties
Physical Requirements
Ability to stoop, stand, climb, frequently lift a minimum of 50 lbs. of equipment (pumps, tools, ladders) and safely install rigging/lifting devices
Regularly required to crouch and reach to install/move equipment by bending forward at the waist or by bending legs and spine
Involves movement between departments, floors, and properties to facilitate work
Ability to speak clearly so others can understand you
Ability to read and understand information presented orally and in writing
Regularly required to utilize vision abilities, allowing reading of printed material, drawings, and schematics
Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
company: Michigan State University Federal Credit Union
description:
Who we are:

MSUFCU has a national reputation for excellence and has received several top industry and workplace awards. For the sixth year in a row, MSUFCU was named as a Top Workplace in the large employer category by the Detroit Free Press. This year, it was also recognized as one of CU Journal’s Best Credit Unions to Work For, a Best Workplace for Women by Fortune Magazine, and Outstanding Credit Union of the Year by the Michigan Credit Union League. MSUFCU has also been nationally recognized for its financial education initiatives, ranking first in Michigan and second in the nation for the 2017 Alphonse Desjardins Adult Financial Education award by the Credit Union National Association. Founded in 1937 by MSU faculty and staff, MSUFCU has 18 branches, over 260,000 members, more than $4 billion in assets, and 875 employees.

A day in the life of a Site Reliability Engineer

The Site Reliability Engineer is responsible for monitoring systems, ensuring responsiveness to alerts, and improving application stability and supportability. This role will focus on automation, scalability, and performance of systems including the core banking application and the digital channels. The Site Reliability Engineer will research and help implement new site reliability related technologies, analyze current architecture and processes, optimize automation schedules, and expand and evangelize the automation vision throughout the Information Technology department at MSUFCU.

Responsibilities
Monitor Episys core banking application, the digital channel logs, and performance reporting to ensure adherence to established service levels
Design and implement automations for routine processes
Establish a high level of personal credibility and build strong relationships with team members and departments in the Credit Union
Use site reliability expertise to collaboratively work with other technical teams to provide guidance and ensure systems and solutions are scalable and reliable
Research and recommend new technologies for compatibility, expandability, ease of use, and supportability
Create and maintain excellent documentation including workflows, procedures, and troubleshooting
Provide on-call support on a rotating schedule or as needed for emergency situations, including outside of normal business hours
Review, evolve, and assist with disaster recovery plans on production environments
Provide architecture design reviews and feedback for new and existing systems, making recommendations for design modifications to maximize availability and performance
Build monitors and alerts to ensure timely notifications on the health of critical systems
Develop scripts used for batch job scheduling; assist with job schedules to ensure stability and efficient use of machine resources
Ensure sufficient logging, monitoring, and alerting strategies around availability, latency, and overall system health
Scale systems sustainability through automation and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity
Support the day-to-day maintenance with a focus on reducing toil or technical debt of the applications while maintaining a high degree of system availability
Assist with stress testing
Assist in the facilitation of the proper operation of site reliability related technologies including the Symitar host and third party systems that interact with the Symitar system. This includes:
Proper monitoring
Ensuring automated jobs run as scheduled and logs are completed in accordance with established credit union policies and procedures
Oversee the coordination with system vendors for the repair of any software or hardware problems
Ensure routine preventive maintenance is performed according to established standards
Maintains accurate and appropriate change control records
Keep management advised of any on-going problems not being resolved satisfactorily or that prevent the fulfillment of responsibilities
Participate in training activities within your department or branch and with the learning and talent development department; such training helps to ensure staff compliance with Credit Union policies and state and federal regulations and laws
Perform other duties and assist other employees, as assigned
What you can bring to MSUFCU:
Associate’s or bachelor’s degree, with a technical major, such as engineering or computer science is preferred
Previous experience working in a Software Development, Dev Ops, Site Reliability Engineering, or Infrastructure position or team.
Proficient in one or more general purpose programming (E.g., Java, C#) and scripting (E.g., Python, PowerShell) languages
Knowledge of various SQL languages (E.g. DDL, DQL, DML)
Experience with automation tools (E.g. OpCon, Ansible, etc.) is required
Exhibit a positive attitude, approachable demeanor, and commitment to excellence
A high level of interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, questioning skills, and ability to relate to other people at their knowledge level
Aptitude to learn new technologies quickly
Ability to create and maintain detailed schematics and other documentation for system and product solutions
Ability to apply research and analytical techniques to the design and development of new and existing systems and products
Curious and innovative nature
Adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands, and handle frequent change, delays, or unexpected events with poise
Ability to work independently as well as cooperatively in a team-oriented environment
Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
Ability to work well with all employees, including managers, AVPs, VPs, and executives as well as software/IT vendors
Ability to solve problems efficiently and accurately and handle complex details
Ability to debug and optimize code and automate redundant tasks
Thorough understanding of the SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle)
Experience with system and product performance, reliability, and availability
Passionate about process and automation
Able to manage and prioritize multiple tasks independently, while remaining flexible to changing requirements
Exhibit superior member service and passionate about delivering quality results in a timely manner
Accepts responsibility and delivers high-quality results
Is open and responsive to change and demonstrates a commitment to the process of continuous improvement by identifying and responding actively and with sensitivity to the needs of all employees
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality, remain open to others’ ideas, and exhibit willingness to try new things
Ability to develop, review, and follow documented procedures
Organized, good analytical problem solving skills
Keen understanding of security risks and evangelize the importance of following security procedures
Must be available outside of normal business hours to assist in recovery in the event of a failure or outage of a critical credit union system.

title: Vision Signal Processing Lead Engineer
description:
Mitsubishi Electric Automotive America creates high-quality in-car systems for major OEMs around the world. Known for our innovative components, we leverage our deep technology expertise to deliver autonomous-ready infotainment and ADAS solutions, premium audio systems, high-definition displays, and powertrain electronics for standard, EV, and hybrid vehicles. Utilize a comprehensive understanding of current and research future trends in vision processing hardware and software (Open CV, Python, C++, MATLAB)

Sales Support

Support and assist the Senior Engineering Manager as needed.
Support and make recommendations to improve Company policies and procedures.
Further the goals and positive, professional image of the department by analyzing current processes, procedures and systems and makes recommendations for improvement for own job.

title: IT Systems Administrator/Engineer
description:
PrimePay, LLC is an employee management solutions provider offering a full range of integrated payroll and HR support services to small and mid-sized companies. We have a full-time opening for an IT Systems Administrator/Engineer. This position is responsible for the day to day maintenance of our multi-site information technology infrastructure, as well as the implementation of strategic projects as assigned.

Job Responsibilities:
Research and implement IT security best practices and keep up with industry standards
Setup and configure MS Windows, Linux and vSphere servers
Work with and administer Active Directory, ADUC, ADGP, and ADSS
Manage Microsoft Exchange and Linux mail systems
Configure network devices such as firewalls, L2/L3 switches, WAP’s, VOIP systems and other communication hardware
Manage and maintain SAN and NFS data storage systems. Familiarity with NetApp devices preferred
Maintain IIS and SQL servers
Proactive Server/Device Monitoring and Reporting
Keep software and firmware up to date on server/network hardware
Manage Data Backups and Recovery

title: Software Engineer (.NET) - ClubLabs
description:
ClubLabs is the innovation and digital acceleration team for Automobile Club of Southern California, also known as, AAA. title: Senior Software Engineer AI / ML
description:
About SugarCRM, Inc.

SugarCRM enables businesses to create extraordinary customer relationships with the most empowering, adaptable and affordable customer relationship management (CRM) solution on the market. We are the industry’s leading company focused exclusively on customer relationship management. Helping our clients build a unique customer experience through great customer relationships is our sole focus.

Recognized by leading market analysts as a CRM visionary and innovator, Sugar is deployed by more than 2 million individuals in over 120 countries and 26 languages. Companies large and small are turning from yesterday’s CRM solutions to rely on Sugar to manage customer relationships.

Where do you fit?

The Sugar AI team's mission is to build products and services that help people make better and faster decisions, automate tasks and processes and extend reach through virtual assistants and agents. Our products and services help users sell more effectively and provide better service by bringing users a wealth of real-time knowledge.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, performance-driven self-starter and team player. You must have stellar software development, project organization, and communication skills, and work well in cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an exceptional full stack engineer with a background in system design, microservices architecture and technologies such as Node.js, Backbone, React, Angular2, and jQuery.

Impact you will make in the role:
You will create new and exciting products under the umbrella of an already solid and mature CRM leader
Work cross-functionally with other teams within SugarCRM to help implement the strategic vision of the product
Push the envelope of software design and architecture
Challenge, mentor, and learn from your peers
What you need to succeed:
5+ years in software development
Experience with Node.js API/backend development in a cloud-based, scalable, fault tolerant architecture
Passionate about AI and Machine Learning and stays up-to-date with the latest developments in the field
Experience with client-side technologies (HTML5, CSS3) and JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone.js, React, and Angular 2 (and above)
Solid Computer Science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, design patterns, databases, operating systems, and debugging
Experience with microservices architecture
Experience with REST APIs
Experience with source control such as Git/Bitbucket
Exposure to container technologies: Kubernetes, Docker, and AWS
Exposure to DevOps and CI/CD configuration management
BS degree in Computer Science, or equivalent
Location: Cupertino, CA

We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Engineering Team Culture:

Our focus is building out teams with smart engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to build software for our unique solutions in the CRM (customer relationship management) space. At SugarCRM, you'll have the chance to work on various teams and stacks. Here's more:
Communication and collaboration is key to our processes, and we don't want to hinder it with walls
We are passionate about automated testing to deliver a high level of quality to our customers
We use a Scrum-based development methodology that includes daily stand-ups, regular Sprint reviews, and retrospectives to discuss
We value unique perspectives brought by diverse backgrounds and experiences. A broad range of ideas and perspectives help us to create the best possible product
As a part of our company culture, we encourage everyone to work at a healthy, sustainable pace
Benefits and Perks:
Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring, innovative work, we have some great benefits and perks:
Competitive salaries
Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans like 401(k) match
Unlimited Paid Time Off Policy
Wellness Reimbursement and Workforce Fitness Program
Career & Personal Development Program – multi-platform
New Hire Onboarding for all new employees worldwide – at Corporate Headquarters in Cupertino, California
Regular social events and birthday celebrations (yes, sweet treats are a big deal at SugarCRM)
Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an impact now
We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career
Learn more on LinkedIn and Twitter @LifeAtSugar

Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: SugarCRM does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any SugarCRM employee. SugarCRM will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of SugarCRM and will be processed accordingly.

title: System Test Engineer
description:

title: BIM Engineer
description:
MB BIM Solutions is a team of engineers located in the Denver Tech Center, and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of G.H. Phipps Construction Companies. We use our design, software, and construction coordination backgrounds to offer BIM consulting services to GH Phipps, other general contractors, and specialty subcontractors. Our main service offerings include fabrication modeling and shop drawings for various building systems (such as precast concrete, rebar, cast in place concrete, and MEP systems), 3D coordination and clash detection, construction sequencing and schedule simulations, construction visualization and virtual reality, and structural engineering consulting. We work on high-profile large commercial construction projects throughout the Rocky Mountain region. Our service offerings continue to expand as we grow to include leading BIM technologies and project delivery methods. We are a small, dynamic firm that drives and adapts to advances in BIM technology, workflows, and practices. Our success is a direct result of having a team that is innovative, software-driven, and forward-thinking. With our small company atmosphere and culture of innovation, each team members ideas and contributions are highly valued.

We are seeking candidates who are independent, self-motivated, creative, and quick to learn new software and applications. We are interested in candidates with a background in structural engineering, architecture, mechanical engineering or design, or construction that have a strong expertise in BIM software.

Position Summary:

The BIM Engineer is responsible for creating and coordinating BIM content for multiple disciplines in various software platforms. The BIM Engineer implements and uses technical software processes to support construction teams from preconstruction through project closeout.

Essential Functions:
Read, interpret, and understand architectural, structural, and MEP design drawings
Build accurate, detailed, and data-rich Revit models to a fabrication level of detail for various scopes of work
Develop Revit skillset necessary to function at a high level of efficiency, accuracy, and productivity
Understand basic construction operations and techniques
Coordinate drawings and models from various trades and disciplines and use BIM to identify, coordinate, and resolve construction conflicts
Create drawings from fabrication level models that increase field productivity
Use BIM to help general contractors to solve project-specific constructability issues
Create 4D construction sequencing simulations in Navisworks Timeliner
Support general contractor project pursuits with creative use of BIM models and animations within 3D Studio Max, SketchUp, drone photogrammetry, and virtual reality
Support preconstruction departments by using BIM for site logistics and model-based quantity take-offs
Use Navisworks to leads the BIM coordination process between the MEFP trades and the design models
Create shops drawings in Revit for trades such as cast-in place concrete, precast concrete, and mechanical and plumbing systems
Utilize point clouds from 3D laser scans and drone photogrammetry to document and coordinate as-built conditions
Contribute to the implementation of new BIM processes and services for general contractors and trade contractors
Help train construction team members in the use of BIM
Communicate effectively with team members with a positive and solution-oriented manner
Successfully perform tasks and deliver projects within deadlines and budgets
Contribute to the fast-paced evolution of our BIM services and processes
Minimum Qualifications:

Education:
Bachelors Degree or extensive experience in engineering, construction management, or architecture
Experience:
2-5 years of experience in the AEC industry
Skills:
Completion of beginner or intermediate level of training in BIM/VDC software
Proficiency in Revit, Navisworks, and other BIM software is very desirable
Strong software and general computer knowledge, and an ability to quickly learn new software applications
Understanding of architectural, structural, and MEP design drawings and shop drawings
Understanding of basic construction means and methods
Ability to adapt to a deadline-driven and fast-paced construction environment
Strong communication skills and client service approach
Ability to adapt to evolving BIM software, technology, processes and services
Salary and Benefits Package:
Competitive Salary
Bonus Program
Flexible Work Schedule
Employer-Paid Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance

title: Lead Engineer (Full Stack Front End Developer)
description:
Lead Engineer (Full Stack Front End Developer)

Location: Bethesda, MD

WealthEngine (WE) is seeking a Lead Engineer (Full Stack Front End Developer) to collaborate with a group of elite software engineers to design and build our marque product in implementing exceptional modern, responsive user experiences and build the back-end API layer. Our technology powers the campaigns of some of the biggest non-profits, universities, financial service firms, and luxury brands in the country. Using actionable wealth and lifestyle insights, WE fuels highly-targeted campaigns that continuously deliver measured outcomes. The WE platform is powered by more than half a trillion data points and uses proprietary learning science to create WE profiles for more than 250M people in the US.

If you are experienced in a variety of front-end frameworks, back-end languages, SQL,No-SQL database technologies and have excellent communication skills, then we want to talk with you right away!

Clients use our technology to accelerate their campaigns. We help them find and influence wealthy individuals who have the capacity and propensity to donate to their cause.

Here's what you'll do:
Full stack software development to implement modern, responsive user experiences
Build the back-end API layer
Rapid development of software based on architecture requirements
Develop and maintain code, integrating software components into a fully functional software system
Learn and adopt new languages, infrastructure concepts, and technologies and implement them effectively in projects
Along the way, you will also:
Serve as a subject matter expert for system specific issues, processes, and regulations
Collaborate and work cross-functionally in designing and building our marque product
Participate in company training and professional development opportunities and also in our parties and picnics!
What We're Looking for In You
A development athlete with 3+ years' experience and a passion in understanding business challenges and requirements and turning them into working software
Solid experience building web-based systems using React.Js (preferred) or Angular.Js
Working experience in a wide variety of databases, including both relational databases and NoSQL databases such as Cassandra (preferred), MongoDB, Oracle, or ElasticSearch
Knowledge of Scrum or Kanban process
Experience with Jira, Confluence, DevOps tools, and Unit testing

401k plan

Lots more!
How to Get This Job

If you would like this story to be yours, send us a copy of your resume and a letter telling us why you would be the ideal fit for this role. We think your ability to communicate in writing is very important, so we'll read your letter first.

This is a full-time position in our Bethesda, MD office (easy access from Metro's Red Line).

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
In JFrog, you will have the opportunity to build the future of DevOps for some of the most innovative and successful organizations in the world. JFrog, with the breathtaking vision of Liquid Software, supports millions of Developers and DevOps Pros around the world, including Netflix, Amazon, LinkedIn, Yahoo, Google, SalesForce, Cisco, EA, Spotify, Twitter, Oracle, VMware, and EMC. Beyond any specific perk, what we believe matters most is creating an open and positive work environment where everyone has a voice and everyone matters. As a Solutions Engineer at JFrog, you will be on the front lines, working closely with our customers and prospects, walking them through our solution offerings and guiding them on how to build robust DevOps processes. You will work with our sales, product & engineering teams to help customers understand the value of JFrog solutions from a technical and business perspective.

If you love working with brilliant people, being part of an energetic team, changing the world of software and you’ve got the technical skills, you might be the perfect Frog to join our Swamp! Come and help us to continue to lead the rapidly evolving space of Continuous Integration and Delivery!

Introduce and design JFrog solutions to our Enterprise customers in pre and post sales engagements

title: Software Engineer - Cloud Developer
description:
Software Engineer - Cloud Developer - Must hold active Top Secret Clearance

*Due to US Government security clearance requirements, all applicants MUST be US Citizens. ONLY US Citizens are eligible for the clearance necessary for this position.

Are you a developer interested in working on distributed systems in modern cloud environments with a small team of other technically curious developers? Then this is the ideal position for you! Expedition Technology is a growing company that is leading the artificial intelligence and machine learning movement by developing smart applications for the US Department of Defense (DOD) and Intelligence (IC) Communities. We are looking for 2 full-time TS/SCI cleared developers to join our team.

Our new teammates will work on full stack development of Machine Learning applications along with a team of motivated and dedicated research engineers. Responsibilities will include building software ecosystems in the cloud to include user interface and backend database design.

This is your chance to join a company that is pushing boundaries in AI and Machine Learning and is quickly becoming an industry leader in deep learning R&D. Our work makes our nation and those who serve it safer by providing real-time, actionable intelligence faster than we've ever seen it done before - and that's something we are truly proud of.

If you have what it takes to join our expedition, we'd love to talk with you. We're going places - are you up for the challenge?

Required Skills:
Active Top Secret or higher US Government Security Clearance (TS/SCI preferred)
5 years + full stack software development expertise - preferably with one of the following: Python, C++, Java or other object oriented language
Experience with Cloud Computing with AWS and/or C2S
Demonstrated work experience with full stack software design and implementation
Strong commitment to sustainable, responsible software development practices
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills along with a desire to collaborate within a team
BA/BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field - advanced degrees welcomed
Desired skills:
Knowledge of cloud-based security principles

AWS- including EC2, CloudFormation, Lambda, RDS, S3, SageMaker

Javascript
